Reviews.Title: “We Have A Winner”
Reviews.Author: amidoc
Reviews.Content: It's better to be lucky than good. My wife was good in booking here and we must have gotten lucky to get a unit on a holiday weekend. This was our 2nd stay at the "Suites". Although our first visit was fine, it was lackluster. Long, slow lines at check in , restrictive this , you can't do that, you have to do this, blah,blah,blah. Grass half mowed, peeling paint, godawful TV, dirty carpet and a faint grandma smell. Not this time. Someone moved into management with an iron fist, a sense of customer service and a modicum of decorative talent. Check in was Mc hamburger fast, the time share shpiel was one question and quickly dispatched with a pleasant "no thank you". Grounds were immaculate and actually put the golf course next door to shame. Wow, 1 more than adequate bedroom, a large 2 entry bathroom with a spa tub/shower combo, big central room with tasteful furnishings, a dining area and a not so compact, compact kitchen. Did I mention 2 large flat screen TV's with a nice selection of channels? Holy all the comforts of home, Batman, I don't want to leave. This is not a $35 a night unit, but before taxes, we didn't even break $100. DVD's planned activities and all the helpful advice you can absorb are thrown in at no extra charge. Branson is the everymans Riviera, and Suites at Fall Creek are a touch of comfort and elegance that almost anyone who puts their shoes on in the morning and does an honest days work, can afford. Like the un- naturally big and moderately ugly guy in the movie says" I'll be back ".

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value, good location, good service.”
Reviews.Author: rmwaltermyer
Reviews.Content: We are currently guests at the Suites at Fall Creek. We arrived here on the 27th of August and will check out on the 3rd of September, 2012. We have a nice one-bedroom suite, with full kitchen, large bathroom, with whirlpool bath and double sinks, large bedroom with a comfortable king bed and a flat screen tv (32"?), an adequate living area with a large (42"?) flat screen tv, a nice dining area, with a table that seats 6 comfortably and a large screened-in porch. We have a full-size refrigerator, with ice maker, full-size electric range, full-size dishwasher, microwave, and stacked washer/dryer combo. The unit seems clean, but could use a facelift (carpet worn, paint chipped, bathtub stained), but the appliances and furniture showed little wear. The staff is pleasant and responsive. We didn't like our shower head and a replacement was furnished expeditiously. There are loads of activities available on-site (mini-golf, shuffleboard, horseshoes, sign-out dvd's, crafts, stuff for kids, etc.) and most of them are FREE, not typically free at other timeshares we've experienced. In response to some of the reviews I've read about this resort, they do have several buildings and some are not equipped with elevators, so you should check on that before you arrive, preferably before you make a reservation! Also, you can reserve this resort on sites like Travelocity at a reduced price, but you will most likely reside in a different area of the resort, allocated to those types of reservations, which may not have equivalent features and/or accommodations. My review applies only to the facilities allocated to timeshare owners and visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Great family place!”
Reviews.Author: JanRO56
Reviews.Content: A very friendly staff member checked us in and explained all the resort had to offer. She gave us a slip saying we had a free gift if we went to the concierge area. Upon going there we were given a nice tote bag, and were quickly invited to sign up for a time share presentation. I declined and we left to find our suite. We were very pleased with our accommodations. We had a two bedroom unit. The bedrooms were large with very comfortable beds. Both had large flat screen TVs. There was a master bath with a great shower and jet tub. The second bath also had a very unique shower. There was a large living area with a sofa bed, two recliners, a fireplace,and a large flat screen with a DVD player.There was a dining room area and a sunroom with a table and chairs. The kitchen had appliances that looked new, and was fully stocked with anything you would need to make a meal. An added bonus was having a washer and dryer. The entire unit was decorated very tastefully with quality furnishings. The whole unit was quite lovely. Shortly after we checked in we received a phone call again asking us to sign up for a timeshare presentation. My husband firmly told them that we did not wish to go to the presentations, and they did not call again. We were disappointed that the indoor pool closed for renovations the first day we were there. It was posted on their webpage, but was not when we booked our reservations. There were two small outdoor pools which were adequate, but very crowded. They have many scheduled events throughout each day that you can sign up for-some free, some with charges. We did have to call in a repair to our jet tub. Someone came in about 30 minute, fixed the problem, and then a staff member followed up with a phone call a few hour later to make sure everything was working properly. Do note that cleaning service is not included in regular room rates. There were ample towels and linens, so along with the washer and dryer, it was not a problem. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here, and can highly recommend this resort,. It was great to have plenty of room to relax in luxury for a price very similar to a regular hotel room. An excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied repeat customers!”
Reviews.Author: TheKCOptimist
Reviews.Content: We are not owners/ time share people, but we frequently use AFV (Armed Forces Vacation rentals website for people in the military) and stay at condos for reduced prices. We have stayed at Suites at Fall Creek 6-7 times, and here's why we keep coming back: 1. Nice furnished suites- in a one bedroom, there's a kitchen, dining area, living room, bedroom, bathroom with walk-in closet, and screened in porch. We always take our portable hammock and put it on the porch, so it's like another reading room. Our 5 year old likes to play in the closet. There are two big screen tvs. Honestly, the couches tend to be uncomfortable, but we work around that. The kitchens don't have every gadget, but enough to get any job done. To make sure we are close to all the activities, we always ask for buildings 20 - 22. 2. Amenities- There's an outdoor and indoor pool, an outdoor and indoor hot tub, plus you can check out some pool toys. They have a free miniature gold course that is fun- maybe not as elaborate as others, but it's on-site and free! They have a tennis court, three shuffle board games, sand volleyball, a horseshoes pit, grills, a playground, and covered shelter area with lots of seats and tables. Inside, there's a pingpong table and foos ball game, Wii, Knect game (sp?), puzzles, small workout room (each of the 6 machines has a tv, bring your own headphones), and some other games. They have lots of movies that can be checked out- not brand new ones, but many fairly recent movies. The Paradise Activities people set up activities throughout the day- we enjoyed the circus games and bingo. When our daughter was 4, she painted a vase that turned out really cute. 3. Location- The Suites are about 1 1/2 miles south of the strip, and taking the alternate yellow or red routes gets you most places quickly. There are several restaurants close by. We've stayed at a couple other condos in the Branson area, but keep returning here, mostly for the on-site activities and location.

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely come back to this place!”
Reviews.Author: texasphinfan
Reviews.Content: Has everything you need in the rooms from washer and dryer, dishes, closets, appliances, TVs in all rooms, ceilings fans and very clean! Beds were very comfortable, slept like a baby! :-) Out of six of us that went there were no complaints what so ever!!! Very good value!

Reviews.Title: “Better than ever”
Reviews.Author: Deanna R
Reviews.Content: We have been going to this property for about 5 years, started off with 1 bedroom for 2 adults and 2 children, then graduated to 2 bedroom the very next year and this year the 2 bedroom deluxe. My sister & I just go there to chill and let the granddaughters (1 each) swim. We love having the fully appointed kitchen and cooking our own meals. The girls get in on the act and cook too! This year we signed up for the Tuesday night mixer and boy, were we glad we did. It is $15 each for dinner (fried chicken & fixins) and then a sampling of shows Branson has to offer. There must have been about 10-15 different acts so we got a great sampling, even including 3 Dutton brothers. This was all done in the activity center right there at the resort, so we didn't have to go far and it was really fun and entertaining. To top it off, the resort GAVE us free tickets to "The Lengend of Kung Fu," which we attended and thoroughly enjoyed. This is a Diamond International property and to get the best deals, it helps to go on a tour. They do have an excellent program for timeshare. It's not for me, but they are not too pushy, so no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: izzylucy2004
Reviews.Content: I am a Diamond Resorts owner. We had a huge spacious 2 bedroom suite with granite and stainless appliances. A dining room next to the kitchen, then another on the sunporch, is where we ate all our meals. Our family really enjoyed the activities provided: pool, ping pong, jigsaw puzzles, movie check out, mini golf. We enjoyed the laid back, simple family time. If you are looking for exciting, high brow amenities and nightlife, then you wouldn't be in Branson anyway. I have always had a problem with the sales presentations. We are owners, and it still takes at least 3 hours to shut them up. I have complained to Diamond about this and will continue to do so until they change it. The local food and concerts are very nice. Don't go to Branson expecting to see your favorite performer any night of the week. The more famous country stars are only there a few days a year, so look at the schedule and plan accordingly. We won't be going back to Branson, not because of the resort, but because we did what we wanted and will be visiting other properties now. It's also not easy to get to. The room was excellent, I would go back if we got that same room. I hear fall/Christmas is very nice time to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families and large groups!”
Reviews.Author: Cowboys1995
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the second time and had a great experience both times. This trip we stayed in building 12 which I highly recommend! It's quite a distance from the pool / recreation area but the accommodations and scenery are awesome! We had a large group and they met all of our requests in an extremely positive manner. We have a new favorite place to stay in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but probably won't return”
Reviews.Author: schmidkk
Reviews.Content: I bought a Living Social deal for 3 nights at the Suites at Fall Creek. Because I got a "deal" I guess the suite was worth what we paid. Not sure what the actual rates are. The room was very clean and I liked that the resort is sort of off the beaten path. They seemed to have a lot of activites available on the property. We didn't participate. There are 2 pools; we swam in the main one and it was very clean. Here are the issues: No free wifi, we paid for it one night and it ws incredibly slow. The walls are very thin, you can hear everything in the rooms around you. We were on the 1st floor and there were only metal miniblinds on the windows. It was impossible to get the room dark at night. And forget it if a car parks just outside your room - it is as bright as daylight! The bathroom really didn't have much in the way of towel bars, they don't clean during your stay and it's almost impossible to hang up your towels for reuse. Don't let the word "suite" fool you, the rooms are no bigger than a hotel room. Ours had one queen bed and a sleeper sofa. It did have a 2-burner cook top, microwave, mini-fridge and small sink. The bathroom was small.

Reviews.Title: “Frankly, dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: Aaron S
Reviews.Content: The room and amenities at the Suites at Fall Creek are pretty nice. Our room was clean, the bed was comfy and it had a decent TV. On the surface it was very good. The devil is in the details, however. The reasons I won't be back are as follows: #1. We have an AT&T account, so we didn't have to pay for internet. However, it was a pain to enter our account information every few minutes when the system timed out. Also it was incredibly slow and thus irritating to use. If you don't have an AT&T account, be prepared to pay about $7 a day for very sub-par wifi. In a day and age where every cut-rate motel is offering free internet, for an at least semi-luxury condominium complex to take this sour approach to such an important amenity, is just inexcusable. That's the main reason I won't be back. #2. Lots of minor annoyances. For example the concierge called us twice during our weekend stay to badger us about attending a timeshare meeting. I had to get pretty rude with him to get him to stop. It was really obnoxious. We started avoiding the common area for fear of running into him. That's the opposite of how a concierge should make you feel. You also have to pay for room maintenance. Run out of towels? Sorry, they're going to charge you to bring more up. #3 The walls are paper thin. I could hear entire conversations next door and it kept my wife up at night. I just can't stress this enough. The Motel 6 has free and relatively speedy wifi. Why doesn't this place? Only reason I can think of is poor management. Don't waste your time here. There are plenty of better resorts in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Too big for its britches?”
Reviews.Author: Kim_Plautz
Reviews.Content: We traded into the Suites for our summer vacation. The pictures made it look like a nice cozy resort. However, when we checked in, we were overwhelmed at the size of the resort. Our building was about a half-mile from the main building and we could only get there by driving on some winding, narrow, confusing roads and driveways. Our cul-de-sac had a cluster of 5 buildings. The screened-in balconies all look into other units. There was a creek running through the property but only 2 of the buildings in our section could see it (not ours). There is very little carry-over noise from side-to-side neighbors, but we could hear every step and flush of the people upstairs. Our unit was nicely decorated and the bed was extremely comfortable. However, the couch and side chairs were extremely UNcomfortable; we ended up removing the couch cushions and using folded blankets instead. The resort had two outdoor pools (the indoor one was closed for maintenance) but we had to drive to them. The main building had lots of activities and events for families. We only did the preview night, which cost $15 each for a fried chicken dinner followed by several performers from town giving snippets of their performances. We enjoyed these previews and ended up going to two different shows we hadn't heard of before this night. There were two huge issues we had with the resort. The first one is that the wi-fi is not included. We ended up paying almost $30 to subscribe for internet access, which was exceptionally slow. The second issue is that if you choose not to go to their membership presentation, they will ask you EVERY time you call the front desk or the concierge if you want to go to the presentation. It would have been nice if we could sign off to decline this and never have to hear about it again. Overall, we enjoyed the big televisions and the comfy beds, but we probably won't choose to stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “I will never book just a room again.”
Reviews.Author: kldav916
Reviews.Content: This is my first experience at a "resort" type property. For a great price, we stayed in a one-bedroom apartment with washer/dryer, dishwasher, jacuzzi bathtub, 2 tvs, one dvd player, screened in porch and kitchen fully stocked with small appliances and kitchenware. The grandkids were impressed with the activity center (pretty good selection of free movies to take to your room, pool table, shuffleboard, ping pong, guest use computers, and daily activities scheduled). The room was exceptionally clean. At one point my granddaughter looked under the bed for something she dropped and found a printed note that said "Yes, we clean under here too" (and they had). All the bedding was freshly laundered, including blankets and spreads. Fridge and stove were spotless. The outdoor pool and hot tubs were clean when we were there. The staff was friendly and helpful. I was unable to go to the timeshare presentation because my husband was not with us-probably a blessing from what I've heard about those things. One negative is that the walls are thin and if the neighbors are loud you will hear them pretty clearly. All-in-all, we enjoyed ourselves thoroughly and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: Wlh3sjh1
Reviews.Content: We traded our week through RCI to stay here. Some things were great, others not so much. My son is in a wheelchair, so we needed the room to be handicap accessible. RCI did not have a handicap accessible room so they booked us into a regular room. We called Fall Creek and asked if a handicap accessible room was available to switch to. Everyone was very nice and accommodating. What we got was an ADA room. The shower was huge and he was able to roll into the shower. The pool was just steps from our door. The kitchen was nice. The carpet was dirty and needed to be vacuumed and shampooed. We were just going to vacuum, but one was not available in the room. They were very pushy about the time share presentation. They were always polite when we told them no, but they called us three days in a row to push the presentation after we told them no at check in. The security guard checks that people in the pool are actually staying at the facility. Not sure it they were having an issue, but it got old getting out of the pool to get key card to verify that we are staying there. Also, you have to pay for WIFI and it is $7 a day. This is outrages when you can go to the local Hardee's drive through and get free WIFI. We tried using the Verizon hot spot that we have, but it wouldn't always work (maybe too many people trying to do the same thing). We would go back and stay again, but wouldn't buy into time share.

Reviews.Title: “Updating is needed!”
Reviews.Author: pdubs1229
Reviews.Content: I have mixing feeling about this resort. We were in the "older units",(not where the owners stay), and the units need massive updating. Although clean, the cabinets in the kitchen and bathrooms are old and worn. The tiles that had to be replaced do not match the original tiles, so it looks horrible. The stove in our unit is an electric stove, and all the burners are burned. The units as a whole needs to be redone! The units for the owners are just beautiful, but unfortunately if you are exchanging your timeshare you don't get to use those. I also didn't like that the resort is on the same property as a trailer park and a condo community that doesn't belong to Fall Creek. the are owned by locals, which is fine, but it takes away from the vacation experience. If you are staying at the older unit, you have to drive past the owners units, then the condos, then the trailer park and then your at your units. Some people sneak into the pools, we were told that employees of the resort have to check ID's to make sure that the people there are from the resort. On a positive note, the employees try to make you happy in every way. If you have any issues they fix them quickly and without any trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation needed”
Reviews.Author: Sooner4OU
Reviews.Content: We booked this resort for a short three night stay with friends. The check in process was fast and the agent was very friendly. The unit itself was not very clean and had very outdated carpet. We attended the timeshare presentation and the unit they show is very different than unit we stayed in. Hopefully they will all look like that in time because the resort is in a great area with a lot of possibilities. The marina is very nice and the three pools seemed to be well taken care of. The beds were very comfortable and the tv's seemed very new.

Reviews.Title: “Just checked out today”
Reviews.Author: Stacy W
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a week at Fall Creek. Our kids are 6, 11, and 15, and all of them had a great time. The pools, activity center, and mini golf were all very well maintained. The rooms were beautiful, and the kitchen couldn't have been missing anything!!!! The beds and linens were fantastic, and the jacuzzi tubs were great too. We loved having a washer and dryer in our room. We had light bulbs burned out, and they were replaced within 15 minutes of calling the front desk. We were pleased with everything, and we look forward to going back. My only suggestion - put drapes in the bedrooms. The outside light woke us up far too early!

Reviews.Title: “decent room”
Reviews.Author: Awtwo B
Reviews.Content: the tv's in the room were all fairy new, large and were quite impressive. there was one in the living room and one in every bedroom; all the same. the patio areas were screened in which made sitting out on them a bit more enjoyable and you could leave the door open at night and not worry about being eaten alive by bugs. the mirror in the bathroom was quite large, but the lighting was poor. the shower was weird and sat at an angle that made it uncomfortable and awkward even though it was quite spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go to the timeshare presentation”
Reviews.Author: musgroves
Reviews.Content: This facility was fine, clean, updated room. All was good until we did not buy into their timeshare presentation... after that no one was friendly, no chit chat, no conversation as there was before... Very high pressure "tag team" sales people. Very uncomfortable situation. Daily fee for Wi-Fi which is unheard of these days...

Reviews.Title: “Big surprise”
Reviews.Author: Debra J
Reviews.Content: Last minute trip to Branson (we're only 3 hours away) booked hotel off hotels.com the reviews were consitenly good for this property. Check in was easy, no hassel, when we got to our room we had a one bedroom unit! Huge room, large living area, screen in porch, full kitchen large bathroom. Everything was clean, our neighbors must have been quiet we never heard them and the place was full! We even used some of the amenties of the resort, got a couple of movies from the activity center. A perfect relaxing place for us.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: ByeByeGrammy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at Suites at Fall Creek with another couple. We stayed in a 2 bedroom deluxe unit in building 25. The staff were all very friendly, the unit clean and very comfortable. The unit was updated with granite counters in the kitchen and bathroom, stainless steel appliances, fireplace, and glassed-in sun room. It was quiet and had nice views. There is an elevator that my husband discovered after our guests carried their suit cases up three floors. Due to the recent tornado damage, the nearest grocery store was on the other side of town. But, it was a nice drive, and you can bypass the traffic areas to get there. We were not far from anything. We used the Titanic as a reference point to decide if we went straight, left or right to all shows, attractions, or stores. We played miniture golf one afternoon. They also have shuffle board, and tennis courts, indoor and outdoor pools, vollyball, etc. Also, an activity center that has puzzles and board games. We had an issue with the dishwasher (actually operator error) and called maintenance. They were there in only a couple of minutes. If we get back to Branson, I wouldn't stay anywhere else! Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Best possible location!”
Reviews.Author: ozarktraveller
Reviews.Content: If you want to spend time in and around Branson,this is the best location possible. It is far enough away that you feel like you're in the countryside,but close enough to get to any show within a few minutes,and so close after the show,to come back late. If you book the 2 bedroom unit,there is enough room for a family to sleep comfortably-ask for 2 beds in the 2nd bedroom. The full kitchen means you can cook breakfast and save money. I have stayed here over 10x and never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accomodations”
Reviews.Author: waldopepperpeculiar
Reviews.Content: In March of 2012 my husband and I stayed at Suites at Fall Creek. I had purchased a Groupon for this resort and that is why we stayed there. We were pleasantly surprised with our accomodations. Our condo was clean, the kitchen was well equipped, and our view from our screened in deck was nice. Our bedroom had a door that opened out onto the deck and the living room had sliding doors that opened out onto the deck, hence, we could enjoy the outdoors from both rooms. Our deck overlooked the White River. I was lucky enough to see a pair of Bald Eagles nesting in the trees on the opposite side of the river. We enjoyed our stay at the Suites at Fall Creek. Would probably stay there again if we got another incentive like Groupon.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutley wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy S
Reviews.Content: I first have to say that we purchased our stay at this resort through a fundraiser silent auction at church so I don't have a true feel for the value of our stay since we paid WELL below the daily rate. THE STAFF: From check-in to check-out (and even the weeks leading up to it) all staff members, whether dealt with face to face or over the phone, were very courteous, knowledgeable and helpful. We were very pleased with the ease of obtaining travel directions, securing extra kitchen & bathroom supplies and even receiving a pardon for a few dishes that were broken during our stay. Very impressed. THE PROPERTY: This campus is very spacious and set back from the main road so it remains rather quiet and has limited traffic. The property is very large from the main office building to the building we stayed in so any visits to the front required car transportation (which is not a big deal). Other than our condo our party used the fitness center (which is small but sufficient for our needs) and the indoor pool and hot tub were nice as well. The pool had many guests in it but... its a pool we expected that. OUR CONDO: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite which was perfect for our two, 4-person families. One room had a King bed, the other had a Queen & a Full sized pull-out couch. The living room also had a Queen sized pull-out. Our unit was very clean and well appointed with fairly new and nice furniture, 3 Sharp Aquos flat panel televisions (living room was a 52" I believe). The kitchen had nearly all we needed for preparing and cooking our meals. The bathrooms had plenty of towels, etc. and the water pressure was fine. We did lose hot water at one point but only after numerous showers. We really loved the screened in patio at night for board games and adult beverages. The only recommendation I have would be to install curtains on windows facing parking lots because a lot of light comes through the blinds at night. This isn't a complaint however because you usually sleep with your eyes closed I believe. Fantastic stay in an awesome property and we hardly even utilized all their accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: NDBlone
Reviews.Content: This was a timeshare exchange for us. I thought we were getting a 2 bdrm, instead were given a 1 bdrm. It did have a nice sized pullout sofa which the grandkid's shared. Mattress was very thick unlike the thin one mentioned in a previous review. Plenty of room for 2 adults and 2 sm children except the 1 bathroom was snug:(. Played the 18 hole mini-golf, swam in the indoor pool several times (a bit chilly though), sm indoor hottub which wasnt too hot (nice) and several planned activites throughout the week. The screened in patio was a nice touch. Sure, the rooms could have been nicer, and I did see that the larger units have been updated...we just didn't happen to pay for one of those. We own several timeshares and RARELY use them as our source of entertainment. They are rooms to sleep in while we enjoy the activites in the areas we visit. I guess we just aren't as picky as most people. We were here over spring break and would consider coming back to use the outdoor amenities in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful units”
Reviews.Author: Teamconcho
Reviews.Content: My husband and two friends and I stayed here last summer and were pleasantly surprised when we walked into the unit. It was huge and beautiful. We especially liked the screened patio that looked over the forest and even had a ceiling fan. Check in was easy, we got discounted tickets for shows and even the sales pitch for a timeshare was friendly and easy. The only thing we did not like was the distance from the pools and the front office and activities.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay when in Branson.”
Reviews.Author: mariondude
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small apartments. Full kitchen. Whirlpool tubs. Only issue I had was the sofa bed. The mattress was literally and inch think and you could feel every spring in your back. The master bedroom was very comfortable though. There is also a 100.00 deposit that I wasn't aware of before check-in .

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but avoid the presentation.”
Reviews.Author: mebejim
Reviews.Content: The Suites at Fall Creek - Branson We had a lovely time in the 2 bedroom deluxe unit. It was a pleasant 3 nights. Check in was flawless and the staff was all smiles. We were recruited into a presentation that was supposed to be 90 minutes and no pressure. It turned out to be 2 hours and 40 minutes and the pressure came in the form of not listening to us. The suite was comfortable and well equipped. The kitchen was complete and we wanted for no tools. There was no salt and pepper. Everything was clean and in it’s place. One unique touch was a lighted reversible makeup mirror. My wife was thrilled. The beds were soft and we slept well except when the folks upstairs were awake and dancing. We were privy to their conversations and presumably, they to ours. We were there in the off season and the place was largely empty so I cannot vouch for the walls, but the ceiling and floors transmit sound quite efficiently. The view from our dining room was the trailer park that was about 10 yards from our window. Now, it’s a nice trailer park, but not the view for which we came to Branson. The only other defect was the water pressure in building 25. I am not sure if they were telling me the truth, but maintenance said that it was not the valve, but the pressure that would not allow us to fill the bath tub. Please do not allow these deficits to put you off. I only list them because I prefer full disclosure. I will come back and recommend it to others. I do not think I will take another diamond presentation.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of light, no water pressure, no ice....lots of finger pointing to reservations getting the blame”
Reviews.Author: bblnlmc
Reviews.Content: I stayed in building 22 in a studio room. When I rode the elevator up to the 4th floor my feet were stuck to the floor. It smelled like coffee. I got to my room and called the front desk. They said they would take care of it. (still there the next morning). Then I seen the door jam and baseboards, boy was they needing a paint job. Then I noticed there wasn't a oven and I was told I'd have a full kitchen. (called front desk again, it was blamed on reservations department). When I got ready to go to bed the lights kept me up. The windows just had blinds on them. To much light to sleep. In the morning we didn't have to worry about our alarm waking us up cause the walls was so thin the neighbors woke us up. Also when we took a shower, wow no water pressure at all. One tiny sink in that kitchenette. Wonder how people really did their dishes. I made sure I washed everything before I used it. And I called to find out about ice, they said i had to go all the way around to the other side of the proerty because there wasnt ice machines on this side. They did however bring me some ice the first night. But it didnt make my stay any better. I was suppose to have gotten a larger room but was informed that reservations lied to me and that studio room was all I was getting.

Reviews.Title: “Stay only if you get good room rate, otherwise drive on.”
Reviews.Author: Angela B
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel is all about how much the room is.  If I paid  the summer rates, I would have not been happy with it.  We had two rooms.  Found a loaf of super old bread in one.  It was very moldy and clearly had been there for a long time.  Carpet was very worn and had a large tear.  The blinds  were old,  bent and need to be replaced, and whole blind thing was not very well thought out when they opted for no curtains.  If you have trouble sleeping when it is bright for you, this is not the place for you....  Little freezer in fridge had not been defrosted for a very long time.  Normally this is not a big deal to me, but at this hotel, they shut off the ice machines in winter.  You can only get ice from front desk.  Again, normally not a huge issue but the main building (which is also where the indoor pool is, by the way) is not even remotely close to the rooms, so you can't just run up there when you want some.  Have to drive quite a ways.  (Sometimes front desk could not give you ice, so had to wait for security to deliver it to your room after driving up to get some. )  So, i mentioned indoor pool was not close.  That is the least of your worries if you have small kids and it is cold out.   Be prepared, the bathroom for pool is not in pool area.  You have to go outside to get to it.  So if one of your little kiddos needs to tinkle and you don't want to leave anyone unsupervised, you  have to pull them all out of the pool and drag them out in the cold to the other building for the restroom.  They deserve a refund from whoever designed that.  Clearly it was someone without children who wanted to swim in a pool full of pee.  Who wants to drag kids out of pool...  Also pool area was not too warm nor was pool for any adults I was with.     We also wanted to change our reservation twice while we were there.  No one at front desk could help us even though one of changes was just to add a day.  I am not exaggerating when I say we were on hold for over 45 minutes with service.  If I was subjected to this as part of time share member I would have been furious to say the least.  Guy told us there were only two of them for booking reservations.  crazy considering they were working for several diamond resort  properties.     It was also pretty warm that week and the air didn't work in one of rooms so that was also not good.   Also be careful driving through there.  Stuff  is not painted or marked.  It took us until the last day there to find our building without issue.  Also people fly through there.  They share the road with a trailer park and on more than one occasion we were almost hit by someone flying through there going to the trailer park.  Also they have this triangular median as you turn in that needs to be painted!!!!  We drove over it once and witnessed another car hitting it and messing up their car while we were there.  We had SUV so didn't damage ours but would have had we been driving a car.   So why would I stay again???  Beds were excellent, the rates were killer with our groupon, they have this entertainment room with scheduled activities and they give out these great coupon books which last for a year and those were great also.  Not sure those are enough pros to win me over.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: taxman1420
Reviews.Content: Room 1. Right away when we got to our room it smelled musty/mold. After being in the room for 10 minutes my wife couldn't stop sneezing and my daughter's eyes turned red and were running. Called the front desk and in 15 minutes they moved us. They did a great job and were very polite. (later we found out that some of the buildings had been flooded from the lake). Room 2. Had to knock down spider webs around the staircases and walkways to get to the room. Several lights in the bathroom were out. Took maintenance 2 days to get to it. Family of five but we could only take 2 showers before the hot water was gone. Bathtub was disgusting. Some of the dishes were dirty, room was dusty. Pool was peeling and had too much chemicals. Bathrooms in the pool area were dirty. New Year's Eve the activities were disorganized and some of the staff were rude to my children and wife. Attended an update because we were interested in Cruises and HOA dues with our ILX property Diamond took over. Asked for a some written info on how the cruises work and wend straight into how we didn't have enough points and need to buy more. The lady was rude and kept interrupting us when we were talking and didn't answer our questions. Talked down to my wife like she was ignorant. Sat waiting 20-30 minutes while they had to look up info on our account. Came back answered some of our questions on the ILX and starting talking about buying more points but still hadn't given us any info on the cruises. Told us we couldn't even look at the bookings online for 2 bed units at places because we didn't have enough points. I explained to her that we could and she started arguing with me that I was wrong. I finally had to pull up my phone and show her that i could. She said that it would be going away soon. Brought over a manager to offer more points and pricing and by that time were we so frustrated we said no thank you. But we would still like the info on the cruises the lady said that we could look it up online. Then they brought in a another person to to offer us info on a one time sampler points purchase. We explained we wanted info on the cruises. She went over and in 60 seconds had a 2 page info sheet that answered all the questions we had been trying to get answered last hour. She was a lot nicer then the other lady and we considered trying the sampler package for a Hawaii trip (since the sampler didn't work for cruises). The sampler was 15,000 10,000 or 7500 point packages. We wanted 7500 but then they said we couldn't use those for Hawaii. We had to buy 10,000 to use them for Hawaii. The package of info on the sampler didn't say that and no one could find in writing where that was the case. Extremely frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: travel0723
Reviews.Content: This was a decent place to stay in Branson for a long weekend. We were there on New Year's weekend so the place wasn't very crowded so it was generally quiet. I suspect though that the walls are probably pretty thin. We had a family above us and we could hear the little one running back and forth in the room. I'll bet if it's crowded that you would hear room noise from all directions. The studio room we had was decent and comfortable. I was pleasantly surprised that there were no extra charges for anything such as extra towel service. Although there is no daily room service, you can get clean towels and extra supplies with a simple phone call. The activity room in the main building has hundreds of DVDs that are available for free rental as well as games and such. The indoor pool and hottub are excellent for the winter months. Towels are supplied. The walkways to the room are brightly lit, but that's a bad thing at night. There are no curtains over the windows to block all this bright light, only blinds which don't block enough of the light.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Resort in Branson, MO”
Reviews.Author: Diana P
Reviews.Content: This was a very unpleasant place to stay. I had just come from a stay at the Marriott Willow Ridge which was excellent. The outside of the prioperty was very old and the siding was cracked in several places. I arrived at 10:00 (which was earlier than the 4:00 checkin) but they said they would put me on a priority clean which would not take long. Four hours later they had my room and said the cleaning staff was confused about what "priority clean" meant. The outside door of my room looked like it had not been painted for many years. The door jamb was gouged and unpainted. On first inspection the room seemed adequate but when I got to the bedroom there was no luggage rack or furniture for my luggage. I had to put the luggage on the floor, The bathroom looked like something out of the 80's. The shower unit was moldy, the faucets were so old and worn you could not even read the hot and cold symbols. Most distressing was the fact that there was no blow dryer anywhere in the unit. I have traveled extensively and have not stayed at a facility in the last 20 years that did not have a wall mounted blow dryer. The TV in the unit had no HD channels and reception was fuzzy, sort of like analog used to be in the old days. This is a Diamond Resorts facility and my experience was so unsatifactory we are considering selling our ownership.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, dirty, & snobbed”
Reviews.Author: Kelly M
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a trip to branson staying in the resort there, our sheets on our bed were filthy I wish I could show the pics. we were kept up late by noise then woke up at 6;00 am by an employee staying above us. We were treated as second class by the employee's it was like once they had your money they want nothing to do with you. I was told not to touch the COMPLIMENTARY COFFEE. Yeh, right. while sitting in lobby 3 other elderly couples arrived from a long drive & were told "Leave us your cell no. we will call when your room is ready" Now I might be wrong but if you have a reservation I think your room should be ready when you arrive no matter what time you get there. I should mention they are not pet friendly. Even if it is service dogs. I have Photo's of the stains on our bed I will add when I can download.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience! We will be back.”
Reviews.Author: Cowboys1995
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Thanksgiving and absolutely loved the accommodations! We got a great rate and the studio rooms were wonderful. They're located just a few miles from the strip. The front desk staff were very friendly. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: hawa38
Reviews.Content: Knowing that we will be arriving Branson early we called the hotel 1 hour in advance notifying the front desk that we will be arriving at 11 am (hoping the room will be ready). I was told come on over. But when we arrived, i was notified told that our room won't be ready until 2 pm. Bummer, so we walked around, try to plan out our trip using their so called "concierge". There was a couple at the counter with lot's of flyers chit chatting away, i felt like i interrupted their conversation by asking for information about shows playing the next 2 nights. I was given a sheet of paper right in front of me and boomed! they went back to their conversation like i just disappeared. i lingered around looking at the other flyers on the counter and asked for a coupon book and was quickly given one. I wanted to get more information about ziplining, biking or possible bike rental but ohh i felt like such a bother......so i just grab whatever flyers i saw fit and left the hotel for lunch. These were the first impressions i have of the hotel, such professional! When we come back from lunch close to 2 pm, the room again not ready! We were told the earliest possible will be 3 pm. By that point we were very tired, so we headed for a movie just to kill time. When we finally got our room and drove to the apt building, we were so surprise how quiet the place was, there were hardly any cars! We did not see or meet any people in the same building we were staying at. But why did we have to wait 4 hours when we could be easily given one of those empty unit? So frustrated! The unit we were given was a 1 bedroom apt with full kitchenate, dining room and living room. There are 2 huge TV but no HD channels or right cables to go with it, so only blops of blur. The bed is comfy and sheets are clean, so we did have a good night sleep. The location of the hotel is away from the strip if you prefer to be away from the traffic. If only they have more competent and friendly staff i won't be hesitate to stay here again. But judging based on the facility alone, i think this is a good hotel for family with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Noise and cramped”
Reviews.Author: wreednelson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Nov. 11-13, 2011 in a Studio Suite in building 9. No way we be back. The staff was very friendly. We are off the strip. That is the unfortunate end to the positives. The walls and floors are so thin (stick construction, not concrete) every single step is heard above you. Kids in the adjacent units running and screaming and playing starting at about 630am. Our room was clean, but dated and had no couch or chairs to lounge in. The place is lit up 24/7. Great for security. Horrible for sleeping. I guess you could come here if you like light, noise and cramped rooms.

Reviews.Title: “For what we pay.....highly disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Dan_n_Anne
Reviews.Content: This is one of our home timeshares. We came down with friends for a long weekend getaway. The pictures look great and the overall resorts was nice, though when you come into the resort you pass by a pretty run down mobile home (no one living there I don't think) right at the resort entry. What a welcome! Let me start on a positive...everyone there was VERY nice and accommodating!! So the unit was a nice size for 4, with one bed one bath. Our friends graciously took the sleeper sofa, though we offered. I was pathetic!! I was o embarrassed by the quality of the mattress and offered the the main room again. The furniture in the living room was very uncomfortable and worn. OH and we need to pay HOW MUCH for internet service??? We pay over $800 HOA/yr and we can't even get free internet??? Not usually a big deal on vacation but we use our computers to find great places to visit and for Geocaching. You can bet I gave them an ear full when it came to the review. I guess we expect more as this IS part of our timeshare group. If I were staying just as a guest passing through...still don't think it's worth the money! We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wont go back!”
Reviews.Author: Carol P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Nov. 10-13, 2011, had a Studio Suite, and will not return. On the good side, the staff was vary nice and helpful when we arrived, and throughout our stay. no spiders were seen as ive seen in other posts. But, on the bad side, Our room was on the 3rd floor of our building, and we had to go up 3 flights of stairs to get there. My husband is handicapped, and we were led to believe there were elevators. So, leaving and returning to the room was very hard for him. The walls are paper thin, and you can definitely hear everything going on in the adjacent suites.We were woke up every morning around 6ish by the children in the next suite screaming and playing. Our room was clean, but very uncomfortable to relax in. there werent any comfortable chairs to sit in, the only chairs were at the table. The lighting around the complex is not appealing at night when it lights up your room, so if you like a dark, quiet room, this is definitely not the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Not just for spiders. . .”
Reviews.Author: Midwest25
Reviews.Content: Reading the other reviews I have to agree, there were a lot of spiders living in the outdoor hallways. However, as long as they were outside, I had no issues with their living arrangements. I booked a two bedroom unit which had two separate entrances. As we entered, I was extremely disappointed, bed, couch, kitchenette all in one room. Assumed the 2nd room would be a duplicate. After opening the other entrance, beyond happy to find a large unit with a full sized kitchen, dining table, living room area, separate bedroom down a hallway and large outdoor balconey. While the decor might have been a little dated, it was well done the first time and was still very nice. 3 large flat screen TVs (unfortunately unable to get the Packer game . .), all the kitchen ammenities needed, nice bathrooms--however despite extensive hotel stays by both my husband and myself, neither of us could figure out how to use the shower in one of the bathrooms. Large whirlpool tub with a shower but despite pulling, pushing and turning every knob in site, no shower but we were able to shower in the 2nd bathroom. It was quiet on the fourth floor, although the resort seemed to have many vacancies while we were there. The grounds were beautifully maintained, large pond, fall decor, walking path, lots of seating. All desk staff were pleasant although they are very strict about the 4 p.m. check in. Arrived at 3:30 and not given keys until exactly 4 p.m. Several other guests were in the lobby also waiting for keys. At 4 p.m. they make an announcement you can pick up your keys. Overall though, we were extremely happy with our stay and accomodations, Would return and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding accomendations!”
Reviews.Author: SandyAnacortesWA
Reviews.Content: We invited our friends to join us at this resort. So I was hoping it would be memorable. Some of the reviews weren't to good. I found this resort to be outstanding. Our unit was perfect. Quiet, Clean, Awesome linens and furnishings. 3 giant flat screen tv's.

Reviews.Title: “It's a vacation club.”
Reviews.Author: DAKIBS
Reviews.Content: Yes it's a Vacaion / Time Share Resort. We stayed there for a free incentive after sitting through the sales pitch. The room we were given was very small (as expected). Location was nice. Outside the "downtown strip" area of Branson. Resort is hard to find if you don't have a GPS or a good local map. Upon check out there was no employees to be found anywhere in the main building. If you don't want to get "roped into" their company, STAY ELSEWHERE.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Had a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELTNJ
Reviews.Content: We had a 4th-floor two bedroom in Bldg 24 for 2 of us so it was way more than we needed. The staff were friendly and helpful. The concierge was a little dissappointing as they only have info on the many shows on the strip. No info for other surrounding area activities (We wanted to do some kayaking and hiking in the area). Some had their own local knowledge but not the usual maps/flyers we were used to. The on-site activities were typical. No issues with the 3 pools though only 1 of 2 outdoor hot tubs were working. Grounds were clean. Accomodations in the room were average. The place was clean. Beds/linens were nice. LR furniture was well used. We enjoyed the screened balcony with a view of the hills. This place is located near a trailer park, which is nicer than most, but does mess the view up a little. But this is not Hawaii or some other exotic place, its Branson. There are two groups of building to stay at. Bldg 23-25 are near the pool/office and have pool/hills viewing. Bldg 25 has the latest /greatest amenities and you should request a 3rd or 4th floor unit to get a view above the trees/trailers. Bldgs 1-16 are located down the lane on Lake Taneycomo but is a about a half mile from the pool. So it your preference - lake view or close to the pool. There is another pool further down the lane by the marina/dock. This resort sits with privately owned condos in the area and security did say they are working to keep the non-resort people out of the resort pool/marina areas. Location is great, the strip is within 5 minutes and its close to Table Rock Dam area. Spiders...My my yard has them too...they did clean them off the building during our stay. Lighting along the outside walkways did shine into the front bedroom and and kitchen of our place. Fortunately we had a second BR that didn't have that issue otherwise we would be draping sheets/blankets over the curtains to block more light. Overall we expect a nice clean room, everything to work in the room and that's what we got, we enjoyed our stay and would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Get your earplugs and your night mask ready”
Reviews.Author: T-Bone1950
Reviews.Content: The clerks were great and the coupon book saved us money. The facilities are located ideally close to the expressway coming/going in/out of town plus reasonably close to town. Now for the bad news. The walls have no sound-proofing and they leave the eave lights on all night without providing light-darkening shades so if you are a light sleeper or if light or noise bothers you bring your earplugs and your night mask. Otherwise it is a nice looking place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION AND NICE STAFF”
Reviews.Author: pckslft
Reviews.Content: We stayed Aug 31-Sept 1, 2011. The rooms were very nice and spacious. Beds were really comfortable. Loved having a screened in porch right outside our door. After reading a couple of bad reviews before I booked I just picked up the phone and requested certain things pertaining to the room we wanted and had no problem getting it. Staff was very nice. Don't be put down by reading bad reviews about these suites. I am a particular person about where I stay. As long as it is clean and the staff is friendly that is great with us. If I was given the opportunity to stay FREE I certainly don't think I would be complaining about the accomodations:) And as far as spiders on the staircase............lol, this is a huge property. I think it would be a little hard to get rid of every spider

Reviews.Title: “gotta take the good with the bad”
Reviews.Author: Glamazon43
Reviews.Content: The ladies at the front desk were supernice, but some of the grounds were very ugly, not maintained well. Our staircase was covered in spider webs & huge spiders and one of our hand rails was about to fall off. The rooms were very nice & spacious though. The beds were very comfortable. I liked that the location was near to Table Rock lake & a little away from the busy strip. They want to push time shares at you, but I was firm & they left me alone. We had a 2 bed 2 bath suite w/ kitchenette.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: jlkoch46
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a Stuido Room for 2 nights for a weekend trip. Great location and beautiful area. Bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean. Not much of a kitchen area just a small refrigerator and microwave but was good for what we needed. We liked that they kept swimming pools and hot tubs open later than 10pm...when we stayed they where open until 11pm. Only issues we had was that they had 3 hot tubs on the property but only 1 of them were working and they needed to spray outside of the doors and stairways for spiders...webs everywhere. Overall good visit and price for the room...would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: HottyToddy77
Reviews.Content: We own a timeshare and we trade weeks with our home resort for this one. It was our first time in Branson and I did some research on the internet before I told my husband to book this place. I don't liek to go to places site unseen because you don't know what your getting. We was shocked when we walked in our room. We didn't get told very good directions on to how to get to our Condo. We was just told Building 14 and room 1413 no one told us that there are condo's that aren't owned by Diamond. We will come back here and we have enjoyed our stay. Weve enjoyed our fishing from the Marina dock. Only thing that I didn't like was the manager at the Marina is a bit rude of sorts. My husband and I have never ever fished for trout. So we go down to the Marina the other am and bought fishing license and stuff like that. We go out there and get ready to start fishing. quite a few people fishing from dock. Gene comes around and says to me in a rude way. You can not fish here so you need to move. Well, I was a little upset by that because there where no signs marked no fishing.. I just got up and moved. Then I went back inside the store and the guy that sold us our licenses and stuff was so nice didn't get his name should of cause he was helpful and nice. I buy a chair. this same GENE dude keeps staring at me like I've stolen this chair or something. It kind of freaks me out a little because we bought 50 dollars worth of stuff the first time then 16 dollar chair and he keeps looking at me like im a theif. THen the next day my husband goes back fishing and this same GENE guy is a smart !!!! to him. he goes in store to buy a net and tells my husband that he has to see his room key and that he can't fish on the dock until after 430pm it was like 420 and others where fishing. Husband said why and GENE said because its only open to resort guest after 430. Hmm just the day before it wasn't that rule. So my husband said he said ok and walked around the marina for a few mins. got his poles ready and then GENE walked out and said I need your room key because its a 10 dollars a day fee. Itll be added to your room. Husband mad at this point tells him that he isn't paying that cause it clearly says everywhere as long as your staying here its free. Might not go back fishing there again but we have had a great stay.. Sorry but GENE is a rude man.

Reviews.Title: “A disapointed Living Social Escapes purchase”
Reviews.Author: eaking1098
Reviews.Content: It wasn't disclosed at purchase that this was a "time-share" property, but let ourselves get sucked up into attending their presentation which took 2 1/2 hours of our day! Not high pressured? That's what they tell you, after the first person couldn't get us to commit there was up to 2 more sent to talk to us till they finally figured out we weren't going for it. Our room was nice enough looking and big, we did get a condo at the very back side by the lake with a view, third floor and no elevator! You have to pay for internet access and our showers were barely warm. The kids did enjoy the activity room, but everything is so far away you have to drive to the pools. We have paid a lot less for a lot nicer place to stay and had hot showers!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort...Could use Updating.”
Reviews.Author: Deadiebear
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week with a friend through his timeshare and had a great time. The resort is in a great location and we found it easy to get to other attractions from there. The grounds are nice and constantly being kept clean. Our unit was a bit dated though. I see in other people's pictures that it looks as if some of them have been updated but that it is not the case for all of them. The furniture was horrible! The kids couldn't sleep on the pull-out sleepers because they were nothing but springs. You couldn't sit on the couch or one of the chairs without sinking deep into them. The bathrooms could use a major update. It needed a new patio door and new curtains and decorating. But other than that the beds must've been newer as well as the TV's. The kitchen was so nice to have for a week so we cooked a lot of our meals in-house. We lived in the outdoor pool which was just outside our unit. The water was perfect. Security did mention to us that they have a problem with people who aren't guests using the facilities. The resort offered a lot of things for the kids to do and they became "regulars" at the activity center. Overall it was a great stay and we'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Probably wont stay again..”
Reviews.Author: KayleighBjorgan
Reviews.Content: Aside from the fact the studio rooms have a half kitchenette which was nice, a flat screen tv and private balcony this hotel was very disappointing. We checked in at 4 pm. Went to our room and saw that the pools closed at 10 and 11. Decided we would go eat and come back. After we got back at 9 pm we headed straight for the indoor pool (at least a mile away from our room). We were very sad to see that all 3 pools had already been closed for the night. We went back to the room and went to bed. Then, we hear this very loud noise and it sounded like a down pour of rain come to find out it was just our AC unit (woke us both up at least 4 times). Unfortunately, the couple next to us must have had a cold because we could hear every cough, sneeze, laugh.. you name it.. I give this hotel 1 star.. when we woke up to take a shower there were 2 hairs inside the shower.. I was so disappointed mainly because when we checked out its like they knew how awful it was.. She didn't even repeat our name, ask us how our stay was, or tell us when the deposit would be released. Needless to say I should have stayed at the Welk..

Reviews.Title: “great place, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: ronetc
Reviews.Content: The one-bedroom condo with full kitchen has great living area, bedroom, and fully-equipped kitchen, nice bath with jacuzzi tub, private balcony. Price is better at online travel sites than at the hotel's own website. Cheaper than nearly any hotel in Branson, well-located, like having a vacation home rather than just a room. My sister-in-law and friend stayed in the adjoining, connected studio apartment, which was great for the two families . . . easy visiting but privacy as wanted.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE AND WE WON'T BE COMING BACK!!”
Reviews.Author: Jon Z
Reviews.Content: First off, my wife and I have stayed at this resort before. Her parents are owners in the Diamond Resort which has The Suites at Fall Creek as one of their properties and we were even considering buying into this particular property as well before this weekend, but we never had issues like we experienced during this recent stay...one thing is for sure, we will NOT be returning. I booked a one-bedroom suite with full kitchen/living room and a jacuzzi tub for a romantic getaway. Our room was on the second floor and upon climbing the steps, we noticed that the siding and windows were covered with dead bugs, mildew, and mold. The inside of the suite appeared to be clean but upon further inspection, we found that not to be the case. Each suite has a screened in balcony that has sliding glass doors and the first thing we noticed was that there was a 10inch gap between one of the glass panes and the siding on the porch. Upon further inspection, I saw that some of the brackets that are supposed to hold the pane in place were missing. We called the front office and they sent a maintenance man up to fix it...not a big deal. I also had to kill a couple spiders that had made a home around the TV, but I just attributed that to the fact that the glass pane was out of place for who knows how long. Afterwards, my wife and I went out to get dinner and returned to our room to eat and have a nice relaxing evening in the jacuzzi tub. My wife went to close the curtains before we sat down to eat and something, which was the size of a large mouse, fell out from the top of them and onto one of the chairs. Upon further inspection, I found it to be a giant clump of hair that looked like it came from a drain of a tub...needless to say, we lost our appetite. While my wife was calling the front office to let them know of the disgusting wad of hair that we had found, I noticed that the jacuzzi tub looked dirty. I ran my hand on the bottom of it to see if it was just a stain and my fingers turned black. We told the front office about this too and they said that they would send someone up to clean the tub and that they would have maintenance come up and look at the hair. The person also told us that they would e-mail their manager and that we would receive a call the next morning from him/her regarding our complaints. The maintenance guy did show up and he was pretty disgusted about the hair as well and said that he would take it down to show the front office. No one ever showed up to clean the tub... We never received a call from the manager the following day and when we went to check out the next day, they tried to get us out of their as fast as they could. We asked to speak to a manager and we spoke to the Front Desk Manager who was apologetic for everything that happened, but told us that since we booked through RoomStays and not "Through Him", there was nothing that he could do to refund us at all on our stay. He said that the most he could offer was a $50 gift card but said that the General Manager of the resort could do more. He said that he would have the GM call us when they got in for the day. We waited 3 hours and then received a call from the Front Desk Manager again (not the GM) and he said that the GM talked with their Corporate and that they weren't willing to do anything else for us except offer us the $50 gift card. We told them we would be contacting the Diamond Resort's Corporate office ourselves and that was about the only time that he actually sounded concerned about the whole matter. He pleaded with us to not contact them and to just take the gift card with which we told him that he could send the gift card out if he wanted to, but we were still calling the Corporate Office. As I said above, we will NOT be staying at this resort ever again. This place made our nice getaway a total nightmare and I never thought I would be so happy to get home

Reviews.Title: “Broken Promises”
Reviews.Author: T P
Reviews.Content: The day prior to our arrival I called to verify that my special requests (ground floor and nonsmoking units for medical purposes) had been satisfied. I was informed that my needs were fulfilled and the reservationist even quoted the exact room locations. We arrived at the resort more than two hours before the official check in time to assure we would be assigned the type of units our party needed. We were thrilled to still be in a nonsmoking ground floor unit. However, we could not receive the keys to the room until check in at 4:00. We arrived back at the resort at 7:00 and was informed by the front desk that our room had been moved. We were now in a SMOKING THIRD FLOOR room. The clerk could not provide an explanation and said there was nothing she could do at the time. I asked her to research the problem and let me know why the switch occurred. I finally had to call the front desk later the next day. I was told that the clerk wrote down the wrong number when we checked in. I knew that wasn't correct because I had verified our rooms the day before. Then I was told something might be wrong with the unit but I knew other residents were occupying it so that couldn’t be the reason. I was then transferred to another employee who was extremely apologetic but never provided an explanation for the switch. We are left to assume that a more important guest came along and demanded a ground floor unit. Since we didn’t actually have our keys yet, the resort gave our room away. The units were nice and clean. They did meet our requests of keeping our newly updated units close together. The large flat screen tvs were a bonus. The location of the resort is also nice being off the strip but still close to the shows and the lake. Maintenance was also prompt to respond to our service call.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous accommodations for wedding party!”
Reviews.Author: michellekb
Reviews.Content: Here's the best tip for ALL - find the price on Expedia first. Then call the hotel and they will match the price. I paid $74 a night for a wonderful 1 bedroom with full size kitchen, washer/dryer, jacuzzi bathtub, livingroom and screened in porch. I paid $57 a night for a studio apt. for other family members. You must pay the price upfront to get the deal which I gladly did. I travel for business every 3 weeks and trust me this beats all the 3 star hotels I stay in with the Hilton and Mariott properties. The bed was a little firmer than I am used to, but so what. We reserved 6 rooms for our wedding party. They even threw in a wonderful reception hall both indoor and outdoor for free! They also decorated with balloons and provided us a gas grill for our party. One room did have a bad odor upon check in. Once we reported it, they quickly came to the room and deordorized it. Much better. Upon checking out (after 4 nights) we mentioned it was the only issue we had. They gave us a $25 Visa gift card and box of chocolates on the spot for our troubles. Wow, now that's customer service! This is a time share property. There was no pressure to take any tour. They only asked once and we declined. Lots of things for kids to do! 2 outdoor pools, 1 indoor pool, Activity center, miniature golf, volleyball, shuffleboard and playground. If you have any questions, please email me. I can honestly tell you this is a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “An OK place, but nothing exciting!”
Reviews.Author: pastorcraig
Reviews.Content: While this property is okay if you buy a "deal" but their price is tooooo high. The buildings are nice, however, because they are 20+ years old, there is a lot of udating that needs to be done - bathrooms are out of date. The grounds are not well kept at all, and garbage piles up and attracts flies. The garbage receptacles are right as you enter your building on the ground floor - not a pretty sight! Internet service is NOT free as advertised. $6.95 per day! The staff at the main desk is NOT the least bit friendly. Don't get excited about hot water either, it comes and goes. BE PREPARED TO GET A DAILY CALL WANTING YOU TO PARTICIPATE IN A TIMESHARE PROGRAM- THEY DON'T LEAVE YOU ALONE - QUTE ANOYING!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best timeshare suite we've stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: moonjaker
Reviews.Content: Best accommodations we've stayed in with Diamond. We were in delux 2 bed...outdoor pool was kinda small but it was still nice. Grounds were kinda "dead" due to not being watered and 100 degree+ heat all week. Activities were nice for kids and we enjoyed ourselves here.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Accomodations!!!”
Reviews.Author: TexRanger7
Reviews.Content: The Suites at Fall Creek in Branson, Missouri offer fully equipped lakeside accommodations surrounded by the Ozark Mountains and the picturesque lakes of the White River Basin. The accommodations are first class in every respect. The location of the resort is perfect. It is away from the action and traffic congestion on the Branson strip but is only a five minute drive away from it. There are numerous traffic shortcuts to the resort where you can avoid much of the traffic congestion which Branson is known for. The resort has 392 suites which are located in five buildings. The buildings have either three or four floors with elevator access to each floor. Parking is free and plentiful and is located directly in front of your assigned building. The resort has an indoor heated pool, indoor hot tub, outdoor pool, outdoor children's pool, and outdoor hot tub. On-site activities at the resort include an activities department, aerobics, basketball, BBQ area, boating/sailing, bowling green, clubhouse, fishing, fitness center (18 and over), lawn croquet, movie rentals, picnic area, playground, shuffleboard, table tennis, tennis, and volleyball. We booked a two bedroom deluxe suite in the resort. The check in went very smoothly. Keep in mind that the check in time is 4:00 pm so you won't have access to your suite before this time (although you are able to check in). The staff at the front desk was extremely friendly and most helpful. Check out time is 10:00 am, which is the standard for this type accommodation. When we entered our suite, we were completely amazed at the suite. There are many apartments and homes that aren't as large as the suite. It was first class in every regard. The two bedroom deluxe suites include a master bedroom with a king size bed and a full bath with a shower and whirlpool jet tub, a second bedroom with a king size bed and a full bath with a walk-in shower, large living room with a fire place, large flat screen television, and sleeper sofa, a sun room with a table and four chairs plus an easy chair, a full kitchen, and a large dining room. General room amenities include heating and air conditioning with individual climate control, ceiling fans, television with cable/satellite, DVD player, iron and ironing board, telephones with voicemail answering service, and a washer/dryer. The full kitchen includes a blender, coffee maker, cooking utensils, dishes, dishwasher, dishwasher detergent, microwave, oven, refrigerator, silverware, stove, and toaster. In summary, the resort was so wonderful that we wished we could have stayed for a month rather than for only three nights. We've stayed at many hotels and resorts over the many years we have traveled but few would compare favorably with The Suites at Fall Creek in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: andyoScotland
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Branson and we were impressed by our accomodation at the Suites at Fall Creek. We had an apartment overlooking the lake and really took advantage of chilling out on the large, screened porch, watching the wildlife and fishermen. Our suite had 2 bedrooms, both of a good size, living room, full kitchen and laundry facilities. There was even a second, smaller, screened sitting area off the front bedroom. All of the kitchen appliances were new and of high quality. The resort covered a big area and to be honest, you had to drive up to reception and the recreational facilities, but maybe that is just a sign of me getting older? Anyway, if ever we find ourselves in Branson in the future, we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: rrichnow
Reviews.Content: We actually came in July 2010 for four days. We loved the condo and were impressed with how new and wonderfully furnished it was with new cherry wood tables and chairs, wonderfully comfortable Queen sized bed, and jacuzzi tub that was great. We did have to call house-keeping/maintenance about our toilet overflow but they came and cleaned up satisfactorily. The central location and different pool options were very nice. The result had a Bar-B-Q dinner one night with several of the city's entertainers doing a ten minute presentation that was dynamic and fun-filled for all. The Bar-B-Q dinner was quite good as well and cost only $14 per person with the live performers from about 10-12 different venues performing. We can't recommend it enough if everyone receives the treatment we did. The game room was wonderful for the kids too. Lots of things to do and with supervision.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings -- make sure you stay in a newer room!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea_in_T_Town
Reviews.Content: The lobby, pool, and public areas were quite nice. However, at least some of the rooms need some serious updating. Our group of 7 arrived in one car but had two rooms reserved. Despie our being in one car, the hotel wouldn't give us rooms in the same vicinity. (The woman at the front desk indicated there were rooms available, but the hotel's booking system -- designed by the hotel's "internal IT team" -- wouldn't allow her to make the switch.) We ended up with two rooms at opposite ends of the resort. The room closer to the lake was quite nice and modern and nicely decorated, but the room near the clubhouse was very dated. The older room had absolutely terrible water pressure in the shower (think a trickle and you've got it). There is also no maid service or room service at this hotel so no clean towels, etc. during your stay. There was a pair of shorts on the floor of our room when we checked in so we weren't impressed by the general cleanliness of the room. Another weird thing was that there were miniblinds but no curtains on the windows of the older room, so there was definitely no chance of sleeping in. Note also that there is a $25 PER TOWEL deposit for checking out towels at the front desk. We thought that was excessive. I might add that we got a great deal for the room, and it was definitely worth what we paid for it. BUT...if we had to pay much more, we'd go on down the road. Overall, this was a strange stay at a strange hotel (but then, Branson is kind of a strange town).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: yogibear2011
Reviews.Content: Let me say my family and I were very pleased with everything. Very nice condos and amendities. We mainly just came and went to do all the branson stuff but wished we would of spent more time in the room because it truly was a home away from home. We loved it! The only complaint I have is we could never figure out how to turn the shower on in the master bathroom or if it was possible and I noticed that the bath tub was not very clean. Other than that we really enjoyed our stay I would highly recommend this place especially if you never have stayed in a condo before for vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great.... Don't Know When Will Be Back To Branson But Would Look Into Again.”
Reviews.Author: CallousDream
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the a two bedroom unit with four adults and two kids.... We said we were not interested & wasn't harrassed about coming to a meeting or taking information on time share Pros.... 1. Clean 2. Location 3. Staff was good although the policies they had to use were were odd. 4. Quiet from all traffic. 5. Full Kitchen with supplies so you you could save on the eating out expense. 6. Consierge - can buy show tickets on sight. 7. able to check in about an hour early although business was light all around town so maybe just luck Cons..... 1. Policies - $100 hold on credit card until you check out for potential damage, charge amount for checking out late, had to sign out with photo i.d. or keys for pool towels.etc ???? (Depends On You).... 1. Location to facility entertainment - the complex is spread out so depending on where you're at you may have to drive to the pool, put put, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Little things could have made it so much more pleasant”
Reviews.Author: DayNightTripper2010
Reviews.Content: The apartment was nicely furnished and the bed was comfortable, and it was clean. The stove and refrigerator worked. The room was fairly quiet but it was because our neighbors were rather quiet people--we could definitely tell when they were in the room, running water, etc. The bad news is the number of details they didn't take care of. There was a DVD player--but no cables to hook it to the TV, and it wasn't obvious there ever had been. There was an alarm clock that was off by almost 45 minutes and it could only be controlled by an iPhone or iPod or something I didn't have. The shower had so little pressure it was almost impossible to rinse off. I gave a note with these details to the front desk when I checked out. Wonder if they'll fix them. Since this wasn't a busy time of the year, I was quite disappointed at the disparity between what I paid for the room and what I actually got.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely suite, beautiful location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Jennifercks94
Reviews.Content: My husband and I needed a quick get-away, so purchased a 4-day, 3-night package at the Suites at Fall Creek.
