We stayed in one of the older condos, two bedroom, two baths, full kitchen, two screened-in porches. It was not nearly as nice as the newly-remodeled units, but it was still VERY nice, especially for the price. The location was great, too, with the river right outside our door. We had a perfectly lovely time. We did attend the timeshare presentation. It was not high-pressure, the sales staff were friendly. We toured the facility, learned about their program, did not buy, and were given two tickets to the Dixie Stampede. We will go back as guests (not owners). We really loved our stay.

Reviews.Title: “How high are your standards?”
Reviews.Author: robbidob
Reviews.Content: The clubhouse and facilities are nice. The indoor pool, mini golf, screened porches, and rec/kids room are very useful amenities. Overall, the staff were so helpful with bookings, etc. Since they have various styles of buildings, it probably depends on where you're placed, (we were in bldg. 4), but we've stayed in much nicer time-shares. Our window views either looked through a fist-sized hole in the window screen onto the trailer park or into someone else's condo. They had two jacuzzi tubs in our unit, but the water heater wasn't large enough to fill even one of them with warm water up to the jets. The shower doors were added on later, so it was a BIG step into the tub/shower so we ended up with a few bruises. Again, it depends on where they put you. The river was a couple buildings back, and it was lovely and peaceful with pretty views. The marina is very nice and not a far walk.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms and good location”
Reviews.Author: StephsFavs
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay. It is in a great location. The only recommendations I would say are better parking areas near the rooms as it was hard to pull your car out without hitting another car. Also the rooms could use an upgrade in decor.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience, But Beware”
Reviews.Author: allstardtp
Reviews.Content: We love to visit Branson and Silver Dollar City during the holidays. We chose The Suites at Fall Creek to stay for our two nights. The facility is very nice and our suite was great. We have no negative remarks about the facility itself, but be aware that upon check in, they will place a $100.00 hold on your credit/debit card until you have checked out. Then, it takes 5-7 days for that hold to be released. Just wanted to mention this because no where on the "rules and restrictions" of the hotel is this mentioned. Other than that, we would recommend this facility.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, but let down my poor cleanliness...”
Reviews.Author: UK_Beach_Bum2000
Reviews.Content: Visited in October with my partner and our 8 month old baby boy. The staff we're great and quick to respond to any questions or requests. Our accommodation was on the second floor, up two flights of stairs. That's fine for the able, but would have been a bind for the less capable as there were no lifts. The apartment was well designed and furnished if looking a little dated and worn. It had two doors and could be split into two almost separate rooms, quite useful. The bed was comfortable and the bedroom was large enough for the little one's cot. The blown air heating was a bit random, noisy and hot and cold spots in the rooms. The only real let down to was the cleanliness, whilst generally clean, the jet bath was terrible. Tried it initially and a stack on mold was blasted from the jets, then re-ran it for fifteen minutes. The amount of dirt and debris was shocking, these should be cleaned after every stay, very, very poor show. Used the Wi-Fi, which cost $29 per week, bit pricey but it worked well. Didn't use the pool or fitness centre. Would I go back? Yes. I'd just avoid the bath.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place! We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: missrush
Reviews.Content: In one sentence - It was a nice place, suited our needs well and was a good value. It was not 5 star. We stayed last weekend in a 2 bedrm suite, top floor, on the corner. There were 5 of us, 2 kids, 3adults, one who is in a wheel chair - which always makes traveling a challenge. The staff was GREAT!! Everyone was friendly and helpful. There was a mix up with expedia and we were only scheduled to stay 2 nights instead of 3. We showed our comfirmation email and the manager took care of the problem. (They even sent a basket of goddies to the room the next day with a letter of appology for the mix up.) Our room was very clean and very well appointed! We had everything we needed. The 2 beds were very comfortable with lots of great fluffy pillows! Typical hotel - tacky flower decore but nice enough for a short time. :) The fold out couch was a dissapointment, the mattress was thin and lumpy and we used extra blankets under the sheet as padding. DEFINATELY NOT RECOMMENED FOR ADULTS! The screened porch was a great add on!! It was really nice to sit outside and look down on the grounds and the little waterfall. We loved our location and were glad we asked for a top floor room!! I would HIGHLY recommed calling and requesting a top floor and corner room; the porch/patios are larger and semi-private, no foot traffic outside your door. We were disappointed to have to walk quite a way to the only Ice machine. They could put in at least one more! I will agree that the walls here are thin and we could hear one another easily with all the doors closed. Part of this is because of the layout of the rooms. The second "bedroom" of the suite is actually the one room studio next door with a connecting door. This was perfect for our situation, but if you have the studio and some one else has the one bedroom suite - don't expect any privacy. The pool room is huge and has been recently updated and is very nice!! A little cold at this time of year, but very clean and great for the kids!! The hot tub inside is TINY!!!! Way too small to share with strangers!! There is an outdoor tub that is larger, but it was closed. The outdoor pool area looked nice but is of course closed at this time of year. The playground is really nice! And the volley ball area made a great sandbox since we didn't have enought for a game. The mini golf course is small and we didn't have time to play anyway. Overall we were very happy and will definately come back. One other thing, if you call them and they say they are "FULLY BOOK", don't believe it! We found rooms available on all 3 hotel.com, expdia and orbitz - after being told they were full. and at 60% of listed rates. Then upon arriving the check in clerk says they were "not too busy this weekend". Well, we only saw about 10 other guests the 3 night we were there and the parking lot was never anywhere near full!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a pleasant experience!”
Reviews.Author: Chris64856
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Branson many times over the years and have never had any issues with accomodations. We chose to stay here because online it looked like a very nice place. I had asked for a studio apartment because we had only planned to stay one evening. There were pictures of the 1 and 2 bedroom suites, however there were no photos of the studio. I thought that was a bit strange but figured the studio had to be as nice as the other rooms....It was not! It was absolutely tiny. The smoke detector was not operational. The battery was missing which was obvious because the cover was hanging off. The toilet was filthy, there were hairs all over the back of the lid and around the base. There was a very noticable smear under the lid (the size of a quarter) I don't know how the cleaning crew could have missed that! The bathtub drain was extremely slow and I was literally mid-calf in water four minutes into my shower. I took pictures of the issues but don't think it would be appropriate to post them.There was a family in the studio behind us, they had small children (no problem) but the walls were so thin that it sounded like they were in the same room as us. Needless to say sleep was difficult.

Reviews.Title: “girls weekend”
Reviews.Author: suzieq5649
Reviews.Content: we were in a 2 bdrm 2 bath unit w/a nice view of lake. unit appeared relatively clean ... worn ... but passable until we went into the bathrooms. it was apparent that neither bath tub had been cleaned. then i found used towels hanging on the back of one of the bathroom doors. called front desk and asked that they have someone come and clean both bathrooms and remove the towels from previous guests. when we returned to the rooms we found that our towels had been removed.... the towels from the previous guest still hung on the back of the bathroom door in the second bathroom and neither tub was cleaned. we requested towels to replace the ones they took and were told where we could get them. so during our girls weekend we cleaned our own bathtubs and then washed towels. on the plus side the coffeepot didn't work and it was replaced immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 Star...but Decently Comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: StandnGod
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio suite. The main drawback is that this is a old building and old room. They said they were slowly remodeling, but then they told us we were staying in one of the nicer rooms because these are rooms where the timeshare "owners" stay. That made us both raise our eyebrows because we expected the timeshare owners to have the best of the best. Our tv is a super old tv - definitely not high def or flat screen, and even though the ad said that all rooms have either a vcr/dvd player, we did not have either in our room. I have read other reviews that say that the walls are paper thin and it is very bright in the rooms at night. That is true! We could hear our neighbors talk all the time -- I think the guy might have been hard of hearing because it sounded like he was yelling, hehe. We adjusted to the rooms not being very dark at night. The blinds really don't keep out much light. Our elevator was also sketchy - we nearly got stuck in it more than once. On the plus side, we really enjoyed the indoor pool and the exercise facility. Everyone is extremely nice and friendly. They do not offer free Internet, but since we use AT&T we were able to access free Internet through our home account. You also have the option to pay for Internet. Overall, we were okay with our stay. It was about on par with maybe a Days Inn. I would recommend it only after explaining all details to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “If YOU SLEEP WITH THE LIGHTS ON??”
Reviews.Author: travelchicTulsa
Reviews.Content: The pictures on hotel.com are various types of suites, I searched everywhere for a picture of the suite I booked. One queen bed with sofa sleeper and kitchenette. Ive stayed in more than 5 resorts in branson so I wanted to be sure this was nice. Upion a late arrival, we were sent to our unit, I went up and down 3 flts of stairs over and over, finally called, they couldnt explain where it was. When I finally found it there was no sofa sleeper. One bed for 3 people! So after waiting over an hour we were moved. We arrived at our new suite and unlike the back units these were all lit up. 4 bright lights outside our window and door. White mini blinds with holes, NO CURTAINS!! The only blankets were white or off white and see threw. I have never slept with the lights on nor do I care to. I begged them to unscrew the lights , bring me something dark to cover the window and door, but they refused. This is ridiculous. The mgr should have gone to walmart and bought a cover but he didnt. I did.

Reviews.Title: “Watch for mold before you get in the jaccuzzi.”
Reviews.Author: mumsie21
Reviews.Content: We had to ask to change units when we discovered mold in the jetsprays of the whirlpool. The next unit was some better, but mold was still visible all around the tub door and faucet. The carpets were worn and dirty. Countertops/microwave had not been cleanned/wiped. The sales pitch was long - 2 1/2 hours on tour. This timeshare is definitely not up to par with what we have used elsewhere. Would not return there......

Reviews.Title: “TIMESHARE PRESENTATION TOOK OVER 2 HRS DONT FALL FOR THIS”
Reviews.Author: familyvac10
Reviews.Content: rooms were clean and staff friendly and maintenance people fast to respond. we stayed 3 days and 1 day the pool was closed and we were in bldg 6 so it was a far walk uphill to pool. the putt putt golf was fun. we would stay again but pay for room dont fall for the timeshare presentation it was a high pressure sales pitch that lasted over 2 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: KarmaKaniK
Reviews.Content: This property of Diamond resorts is rated 1 out of 10 by diamond ( actual words by the manager ) We found the rooms to be average but they were located 100 feet from doublewide city. Yes you will share your property with a trailer park. The clubhouse pool is one of the most disgusting areas of the property. It has a nice painting that is dated 2002. This was about the last time the windows we washed as you can no longer see out of most of them. The handrails for the pool and the hot tub were loose. When we talked to II about swapping our week in Hilton Head the also mentioned that they have a marina with boat rentals. This was not true as the Marina was not finished and no boat rentals were available.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were great....beds wonderful....DON'T DO THE TIMESHARE PRESENTATION”
Reviews.Author: loregray
Reviews.Content: The rooms were great...had the room with full kitchen and the attached room with mini kitchen. The beds were very comfortable. The pools were a little too far from the rooms and the security guard asked up for our room ids 4 times in one trip to the pool..a little annoying. We were on the bottom floor and knew each time the people above us flushed their toliet. The front desk staff could use a refresher course in customer service and the 90 minute timeshare presentation was no less than 2 and 1/2 hours. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, if you're a Diamond Resort Timeshare owner”
Reviews.Author: madcatprimary
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio 'suite', which is basically just the third bedroom of a 3 bedroom condo with a mini-kitchen included. I've been to timeshare condos before, and this room was far below the quality I've come to associate with time-share properties. The room, as I said, was just part of a larger suite, and has a connecting door. They other suite was rented to a family with two children, and it was clear they had their room on the other side of that door. We could hear them anytime they weren't out in Branson doing something. Doesn't really lead to a romantic getaway when you can hear the neighbors and can be certain they can hear you as plain as day also. We attended their timeshare presentation. It took 3 hours and it was a very high pressure sales pitch, but considering our room, we were not interested. They showed us a spectacular 3 bedroom condo in a different unit. They made it clear that the good rooms are reserved for owners, and out-dated rooms like ours are for non-owners. The resort was apparently bought recently by Diamond from Centerra or something. They claim they are working on upgrading it. The mini kitchen is small enough that it takes contortionist like skills to wash your dishes. The room does have a nice alarm clock with an iPod dock. The television is garbage. I brought my PS3, as I knew that I wouldn't be able to keep occupied for the whole week I was scheduled to stay. The television is not HD (meaning no HDMI). I bought an adapter from WalMart, but neither of the TV's RCA inputs(front and back) would work. The internet is free for Diamond owners. Otherwise you have to pay for ATT wifi ($30 per week). My spouse and I have laptops. If you have to use this option, download Connectify and share your connection from one to the other rather than paying for a second internet connection. All in all, we were disappointed right away, but after the time-share presentation we were downright angry at the accommodations. We saw first hand that they have better to offer. They would have you believe that this is a very nice resort, and for owners it is, but for the rest of us...stay away until they finish their renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice condos - avoid the timeshare presentation”
Reviews.Author: pfflyer57
Reviews.Content: The Suites at Fall Creek are very nicely appointed condos, very clean, spacious and the beds were outstanding. We had a top floor unit next to the Taneycomo River and it was very relaxing. The indoor pool and jacuzzi was in good shape and we had the run of the place. The computer lab worked well to catch email and internet news. The resort is located conveniently off Gretna Road and makes for easy travel to the theatres and restaurants. We sat thru the 90 minute timeshare presentation that ended up being two hours, but did not feel terribly pressured. The Diamond Resort program is okay, but not as good as Wyndham in our opinion. Overall, I would recommend this resort for anyone visiting Branson who did not want to be couped up in a hotel room. We enjoy the extra space of a condo and being able to spread out with the grandkids. Go on Orbitz and watch for the best deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, for the price”
Reviews.Author: msamylynn96
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in a two bedroom condo. We had three adults and a 4 year old. It was very spacious and clean. We did not opt for the deluxe room, so it was not upgraded with granite or LCDs or anything. Some of the floor tiles were cracked in the bathroom and kitchen, and there were some chips on the formica countertop in the kitchen. But, hey, it had a fully equipped kitchen! That was great for us. Also loved having an open space where my son could play and the adults could visit, but then we had separate bedrooms to sleep in. It worked out perfectly for us. I will comment on some of the other issues that others have commented on. 1) Not dark enough in the rooms at night. This is true, especially if you are sleeping on the hide a bed in the living room. The bedrooms weren't as bad if you shut the doors. I recommend bringing a dark sheet to put over the windows if you want it really dark at night. 2) It is hard to find your room. This is also true, especially at night. We arrived at 11 pm, and the building markers are not well lit. it took us a few extra minutes to find the right suite. 3) Amenities are spread out and not within walking distance of the suites. This is also true. The place is enormous, and if you are wanting to stay somewhere that is all under one room, where the kids can easily walk to the pool, then this you might want to stay elsewhere. 4) The walls are thin and it is easy to hear other people. Yep, true too. We could definitely hear the people walking above us, and I'm sure the people below us heard my 4 year old running around like crazy. I tried to contain him, but the excitement of staying somewhere new was just too much! Despite these issues (which for us were all very minor) we still couldn't beat the amount of space we got for the price. And our room was very clean, so I cannot back up any claims that the rooms were dirty. So, to sum it up. We loved it. We will be staying there again without a doubt. But be aware that many of the issues that others have commented on are accurate. If any of those issues are a big deal for you, then there are lots of other accommodations in Branson that might work out better for you.

Reviews.Title: “This is a beautiful place to stay, much more than I expected for a 1 bedroom suite.”
Reviews.Author: LovesHuatulco
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the accomodations for the 1 bedroom I booked @ Suites @ Fall Creek. I also stayed here in July of 2008 in a Studio and was pleased with it as well but the 1 bedroom had a large living room, dining room and kitchen with washer & dryer. The bathroom had a Jacuzzi bathtub and double sinks. The bedroom had a king size bed. The only thing missing in the bedroom was closet space, only a few drawers below the TV armoire. The living room had sliding glass doors that led out to a screened in porch with a patio set. BEAUTIFUL furnishings!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best activities Center show, EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: lynclarke
Reviews.Content: We have been to dozens of timeshares all of the US and Europe. What made this timeshare better was the FANTASTIC nearly free ($3) show on Tuesday afternoon. The personnel who pass out the parking passes also suggest this show upon check in. We were iffy because we did not know what other shows we wanted to see. But, the next morning we arranged our schedule and we decided to sign up for it. It was the best three dollars we ever spent! Unbelieveable. They had 15 different show entertainers come to the restaurant area and each gave a little teaser performance for 5 - 10 minutes. It allowed us to choose exactly which shows were "must sees" and which ones were not quite our tastes. There were comedians, singers, musicians, and Polynesian dancers. The entertainers were 4 years old to a great grandpa. The show lasted 2.5 hours! The restaurant holds 100 people and it was filled to capacity. They served soft drinks, cookies, salsa, and chips. For those who can not be there on a Tuesday night, the apartment was in good condition. Our two bedroom was nice because each bedroom was on opposite sides of the apartment and each had an attached screened in porch. We had two couples traveling together so we apprciated this layout. Yes, I did hear the person on the third floor get up in the middle of the night to go to the BR, but I should have packed my sound machine. The apartment was not the most up to date that we have stayed in but it was certainly fine for our needs. We do not need flat screen TVs to be happy. We cooked most of our meals "at home" and there were plenty of utensils, dishes, and cookware. The stack washer/dryer worked well and they had two powdered detergent samples. On site, there were two hot tubs outside and one inside next to the pool, We planned to use them but we ran out of time. They were gluing new carpet to the miniature golf lanes so that should be ready to go. There was plenty of places to go for a healthy morning walk. The only suggestion we could think of was the building numbers should be in day glo! They are very difficult to see when checking in at night. We have never been to Branson before. In fact, I was dreading it, but we will be back! And, we will probably stay here again. To the reviewers who are frustrated because they can not be noisy after 10 PM, I empathize but I am happy with the ruling. It was very quiet! The lobby, restaurant, sales rooms, and activities center are in a free standing building away from the apartments. I can not imagine that they would not let a group celebrate there after hours.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing and enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Hope4lee
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the Suites at Fall Creek. I loved the set up of the 2 bedroom Deluxe. It is plenty big for 4 adults and 1 child. The screened in porch was very nice, the bathrooms were great, and it was nice to have a full kitchen, dining room, and living area. The beds were Super Comfortable. We slept so good. My daughter slept on the pull out couch and she seemed to sleep just fine. She loved the indoor pool, playground area, and putt-putt area. The activities area was nice and had plenty of games, books, and movies. Although we really did not take advantage of this because we were so busy seeing things in Branson. As far as the room goes I would say that the water to fill up the tub - if you wanted to take a bath - was very slow. We did see several cobwebs and spiders on the porch outside but this does not bother us at all. We could hear the people above us come in at midnight one night. actually I was the only one that heard them walking around and talking. My husband, mother-in-law, and father-in-law did not hear them at all. The hot tubs are very small - very weird size for a hot tub but they did have three of them. The two outside are in a very good and private area. Overall I absolutely had a wonderful stay at this place. It was great weather, it felt like home in the suite, and the activities provided were reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay here”
Reviews.Author: blueskies2305
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenage daughter and her friend and I stayed in a one bedroom unit. Our unit was one of the older ones (no granite, flat screens and outdated furniture), but the room was clean and nicely arranged. We had a full dine-in area, kitchen, washer, dryer, sofa bed, nice bedroom with king bed, jetted tub, 2 tvs and one DVD player. I loved the screened in porch. Our porch overlooked the bridge and main water feature near the main building. I did notice that the tub/shower could have been cleaned a little better, but overall, we enjoyed the room a lot. The location of our condo was great. As I mentioned, we were near the main building, close to the activities center, beach volleyball court and pool. The acitivites center was great, good for renting new releases, games and even DVD players. The pool was small, somewhat disappointing, and only 1 (very small) hot tub was functioning at the time. The indoor pool was closed for yearly maintanence. We elected to attend the time share presentation....only to receive the free gifts ($125 visa card and 3/2 stay at one of their resorts). We felt very presured by the salesmen, once we said no. Yes, I did say salesmen..there were a total of 3 people you have to tell no before they give you your gifts. If you are not interested in buying, I urge you not to attend the presentation. I will say, that you are given an option to attend or not once you check in, if you say no, you are not asked again. Overall, we thought the room was great for the money we spent. We thought the price was so great, that we decided to stay another day, just to enjoy relaxing in the room/resort. We would gladly stay there again and recommend this resort to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Will NEVER stay here again and would not recommend it to ANYONE!”
Reviews.Author: TxTrixie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for our family reunion. The very first night we tried to all get together in one of the "common" areas at the clubhouse. The outside one was all chained up for the night (it wasn't even dark yet!) and the inside one we were kicked out of at around 10 pm. We are a large family spread across the US and usually only get to see each other once a year, so of course we were not ready to go to bed at 10 pm. We went back to our rooms and got noise complaint calls on both rooms that we had split into and it wasn't even midnight! We had called in advance and informed them that it was a family reunion when we booked the units, and we were all split up. Maybe if they had put us all together, out noisiness may not have disturbed others (walls are paper thin!) I woke up one night in the middle of the night and could hear my neighbors TV perfectly and I don't believe he had had it turned up very loud. The one evening we did get the outdoor pavillion before it was chained up for a family cookout, we got "busted" by security because apparently we were not allowed to drink alcohol there (even though there were no signs posted and nothing in our welcome packet disallowing it). The playground and volleyball court were not lit up at all either, so we had to quit playing volleyball at around 9 pm when it got dark! Overall not the best place, even if we weren't a big group.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the money we spent!”
Reviews.Author: billfedwards
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, our 18 year old daughter and my mother-in-law and sister-in-law just returned from a week long stay at the Suites at Fall Creek. I had read the revues others had posted here so I was a bit worried. My worries were unfounded. We found our two bedroom suite to be clean and roomy. The checkin went fast and smooth and after two days when the air conditioner stopped cooling, maintenance was there in 10 minutes after we called the front desk and repaired the problem within 30 minutes. The beds were comfortable and the washer and dryer in the room was a big plus. We did not have a great view as others have stated, but I for one do not go on vacation to look out the window. We had a great trip and I would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “not suited for a family reunion”
Reviews.Author: TxGrammy
Reviews.Content: This resort did not meet the needs of our family reunion. Other places we have stayed at had large meeting rooms that you can rent out where you don't have to worry about making too much noise and you don't have to worry about shutting down at 10:00 pm. We had 9 units which were all spread out in 3 buildings. We had requested that they all be together. Most were on the 3rd and 4th floors which was very inconvenient since we all had children and the elevator we used was very slow and not air conditioned. We booked 6 months in advance so I thought we could have gotten better room assignments especially since our host is an elite member. We also didn't like the studio rooms separated from the 1 bedroom by only a door. Of course the people in the studio called the front desk twice and complained of the noise. Once was when the kids were playing charades at 11:00 pm and in the other room we were just talking and watching TV. When there is nothing more than a door separating the units so of course they are going to hear everything that goes on. We heard them but didn't complain. The walls in the units are "paper thin" as the expression goes. We were also a little disappointed in the swimming pools. How can you have a facility that large and only have 2 pools available to the guests in the middle of summer? It was very inconvenient to have to pile the kids into the car everytime we wanted to go to the pool or playground. One day everyone had to use 1 pool--1 pool was closed down by the health department and the indoor pool was never open the entire week we were there. In face, there was no water in it. It was supposedly being repaired, but we saw noone repairing it the entire week we were there. There were 2 hot tubs by the main pool--on one the heater didn't work and on the other the jets didn't work. Also, we decided one night to use the covered table area up by the playground. (this is the night we got the calls about being loud in our unit)but all the chairs were locked with a cable running through them. This was around 9:00 p.m. We talked to a group that was sitting at one of the tables drinking beer and they said you have to get there early to get a chair before they lock them up. BTW-They were not very happen with their stay at the resort either. So we returned the following night with our food and coolers to play volleyball and just sit around and talk while the kids played on the playground. We got there by 8:00 so we could claim our chairs before they were cabled up! Didn't see any signs posted about alcohol, yet security came and made the guys get rid of their beer. We're all responsible adults on private property--so lighten up a little!! Just the night before we saw 6-7 people around a table ---all drinking beer. Noone said anything to them. It was very apparent during our stay, that, because we were such a large group we were totally singled out for many things other were "getting away with". Another thing they need to work on is the general cleanliness of the common area porches and stairwells. They were covered with spider webs and the floors were very dirty--needed a good sweeping. We were there a week and had no room service. If you needed clean towels you had to take them to the front desk and exchange them. if you are going to this resort for the amenities, you will be disappointed, We didn’t have a DVD player—only a VCR player. Who brings VCR cassettes anymore?? The fitness center was very small and all equipment was not functioning. You also had to track down the activities director to let you in with her key. Your room key did not open the door. We do not plan on returning to this resort for our family vacation next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Pay Full Price”
Reviews.Author: nina5096
Reviews.Content: The Suites at Fall Creek are nice and well-maintained. We got this room off hotwire, so received a very good rate. I would not be willing to pay the full price for the "studio" unit. The studio unit is simply a small hotel room w/a kitchenette. Do not be fooled by the use of "condo" in their ads. Pros: 1 - Very nice facility. Up-to-date and pleasant in appearance. 2 - Indoor and outdoor pools 3 - Kitchenette is very convenient. 4 - Staff was friendly and knowledgeable. 5 - Onsite concierge to help with show and attraction tickets at a slightly reduced rate. Cons: 1 - "Studio" units are small w/small bathrooms. 2 - Walls are paper thin. Could hear all neighbors, their conversations, tv's, etc. And I felt very sorry for people next to elevators that had to hear the constant traffic. 3 - Windows only have bright white blinds, so very bright early in the morning. Walkway lights shine through at night. Bring a sleep mask. 4 - Have to take out own garbage to dumpsters located next to elevators. Dumpsters did become messy and smelly. Overall, it was a nice place for what we paid. I would never pay full price for the studio unit and would probably look elsewhere if we returned.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the money”
Reviews.Author: Brewsers2003
Reviews.Content: Great place for the money. The room included a kitchen including frig and microwave. Nice pools and hottubs on the premises, and lots of stuff for kids to do. We declined the condo tour offer upon check-in, and were never asked again. The lady was very polite about it. The bad things: low water pressure in the shower, thin walls and room service only comes on Mondays and Thursdays. If you need clean towels in the meantime, you have to take your dirty ones to the office to exchange them. Also, the restaurant was closed while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “It depends on your expectations as to how you will enjoy your stay”
Reviews.Author: guysgirl03
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by stating that my husband, 11 yr old son, and I were vacationing on a VERY tight budget this year and the price we got for our stay determined our selection of this resort. I found this place by looking on Trip Advisor and reading the reviews. Some of them scared me and others were reassuring. Because we were on such a budget, we couldn't beat the deal we got for a 5 night stay. Check in was very easy since we booked our stay online through a travel website and pre-paid for our stay. We did not have any issues with using a Visa debit card for our room deposit as some of the other reviews described. Be sure to call the resort prior to your arrival to confirm your reservation, especially if you booked it online. The best way to describe this resort is that you have a time-share property that has been plopped in the middle of a modular home community and a condo community. From my understanding, The Suites at Fall Creek has had several owners and each company that has come in to try to ressurect it hasn't been able to. Bluntly, the place needs some TLC, but has definite potential. The lobby is pretty typical of such a resort. At check in, you will be directed to the Concierge to get your parking pass. Here is where you will be greeted with your "bribe" to listen to the "welcoming presentation" and then given your parking pass to keep on the dash of your vehicle. As far as the sales pitch, you can take it or leave it and if you say no, they don't bother you with it any more. However, we arrived and the weather was crummy and the forecast for the next day was for heavy rain so we said we would consider it. We were given our room keys and shown where our building was on the map. Well, because there are other condos within the complex, it was very confusing, so we had security escort us back to our building. We probably wouldn't have found it based on the directions we were given at check in. Our suite was on the 3rd floor and it was a building located at the back of the resort. Our bedroom window faced Lake Taneycomo. There was a lot of fog when we arrived so we weren't able to see the lake upon our arrival. Once the fog cleared, it was a beautiful view of the flowing lake. If you aren't familliar with Lake Taneycomo, then you will probably be disappointed that it looks more like a river and not a "round lake". There was some heavy machinery parked down the way from us and there was a lot of safety fencing behind the units. Because of the spring flooding, you could see where the water level of the lake had washed out areas of the bank and it looked like they were trying to repair that. From the building, you could not walk to the lake. We had a one-bedroom king unit with a sleeper sofa. The unit was well appointed, clean, and comfortable. We also had a nice screened in porch facing the lake that had a patio table and chairs. The washer and dryer in the unit was very handy too. A lot of the reviews mentioned that the walls are thin. I would agree that they are not exactly the best and that from time to time you could hear conversation that was above normal speaking levels. Occasionally, you could hear the guests above us walking through their unit, but nothing that was obnoxious or annoying. The shower and water pressure were great. We had plenty of hot water too. My son thinks we now need a jacuzzi tub and the double sinks made it easy for the three of us to get ready each day. As far as the bright lighting, we did not experience any of that because we were in an older building that had a "porch light" and safety lighting over the walkway and stairwells. I can see where someone that was staying in one of the newer buildings toward the front of the complex would have had issues. There are significantly more lights on the main walkways of those buildings. The king size bed of the unit was very comfortable as were the towels and linens. Be sure to take inventory of the kitchen items and linens and note any damage in the unit. . I did just because I don't want to be charged for anything after check out. There was a broken slat on the blinds in the bedroom and a few dishes missing. We gave the inventory list to the front desk so that they could note it and not charge us for it. As I mentioned, we decided to take the "bribe" and listen to the time share pitch. They promised it would take about 90 minutes and we would get our gifts as promised even if we said no. It was pouring down rain, so we figured what the heck! Yes, you meet with a sales rep, hear about the "program" and watch a DVD about "living the timeshare lifestyle". If you haven't said yes, then a "corporate" sales rep comes in and tries to lower the price making it more "affordable" for you. Then they give the "closer" a chance to offer you one last time a "special offer". They didn't whine because we said no and they kept the whole thing to 90 minutes as promised. We were given the gifts we were promised and it was definitely worth our time. Because of the rain, it made the outdoor pool too chilly, so my husband and son utilized the indoor pool and hot tub. They said it was just ok and that the water temperature was still chilly for being an indoor pool. My husband used the fitness center and said that the equipment was outdated and some of it broken and it was a very small area. Again, if you are going to this resort for the amenities, you will be disappointed, as they are not above average or superior. However, if you are looking for clean, roomy, and secure accomodations for your stay, this is a great deal. As far as location, it is far enough away from the 76 Strip that you aren't sitting in traffic, yet you are close enough to great restaurants and activities. One great tip I can offer is that you are a hop, skip, and a jump from Table Rock Dam, Moonshine Beach, and the Fish Hatchery. Even better is that you can take the alternate route to Silver Dollar City! It only took us 8 minutes to get from the resort to SDC by taking this route! We had a great vacation and for the money spent, we were very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne A
Reviews.Content: This place was not at all what it is made out to be. The restaurant was no longer in service, disappointing. It is a glorified trailer park with some condos on site. Lake Taneycomo is a joke near the resort. I appeared to be a muddy river not a lake. The 5 pools turned out to be 2 outdoor & 1 indoor but we had to drive to all of them. Our unit itself was okay but the porches were dirty with butts on the floor. Having to drive to a poll was the last straw, we left 3 days early because we couldn't take it anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Worth more than we paid”
Reviews.Author: gmni98
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews, I was skeptical about staying here. But the price was right, so I figured we'd give it a shot. We stayed in a one-bedroom condo, which was about the size of a standard one-bedroom apartment. Decent kitchen, included a washer and dryer, nice eating area, bathroom and bedroom were fine. Balcony was a little dirty, but we didn't have time to use it anyway. The staff was great, the pools were wonderful, and there is so much to offer for families...miniature golf, playground, shuffleboard, etc. You can even check out DVD's to play in your room. My only complaint was the noise of the people above us. Sounded like they were running a lot. Other than that, a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “great studio and met all expectations”
Reviews.Author: toni30
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel on priceline for a steal like $30. a night plus taxes. It was fabulous!!! We had a small kitchette that we made breakfast everyday, queen bed and a couch that pulled out into a bed that we did not use. We called ahead to get a pack n play for our room because we have a 14 month old and it was already in the room waiting when we arrived. The room was very modern and clean. You can sometimes hear the neighbors but it was not a big deal. We went swimming in the indoor pool that they have and it was very nice but kinda cold for me. They also had a hottub. This is a timeshare place but when we checked in they asked us if we were interested in sitting in a lecture we responded no and they never bothered us about it again. I highly recommend this resort, it was a great time, plus you can't beat the price for a budget vacation

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Room but only in the Daytime!”
Reviews.Author: spellshock
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in a Studio unit at the Suite's at Fall Creek. Upon arrival the room looked great. The bed was made up very fancy and was set into the back wall somewhat with a very cozy atmosphere. However when we turned out the lights, we realized we could still see everything around us. The exterior lightes of the condo are set in the ceiling of all the walkways to all the rooms. The problem with this is that there is a lot of them and they are very bright. The only protection the resort provides you is the flimsy set of mini blinds covering your windows and door. These did not do a very good job of blocking out the light. The front desk said there was no way to turn the lights off. A nice heavy curtain could have solved the issue, but the resort does not provide this in thier rooms. The first night we could not sleep well because it was like trying to sleep in the daytime with all the light. The walls are so thin you can hear the TV and your neighbors talking ( not yelling mind you, just having a normal conversatoin). The 2nd night we had to take the extra bedding in the closet to stuff over the windows and door so we could get some sleep. We would not go back until the resort provides a better fix for this.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: SJF1003
Reviews.Content: We just got home from a long weekend in Branson and were pleasantly surprised with the Suites at Fall Creek. The price was unheard of and the rooms were very clean upon arrival. We had a studio w/Queen bed and it was just right for me, my husband, and our 7 month old baby. There was a small sitting area, kitchenette, and the bathroom was very clean. There was also a cook top, microwave and fridge. If I had known there was a stove I would have brought things to cook for breakfast. But there is no shortage of things to eat in Branson. My only complaint is that the walls are verrry thin and you can hear the neighbors very well (and vice-versa). The only time this really bothered me was when we had put the baby down around 9:30 and the neighbors came in around 11:00pm talking very loudly. I realize this isn't late for most people, but it was a little annoying. However, I'm sure they didn't appreciate the 5:00am wake up call from the baby 2 days in a row. Overall, I was very happy with the Suites and would definitely consider staying again if we ever make a return trip to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort and rooms - 10 hr drive worth it”
Reviews.Author: Likesroadtrips
Reviews.Content: We live in Minnesota and drove 10 hours not sure of what to expect of the resort. We stayed in a 2 bedroom 2 bath deluxe suite, the room was gorgeous. We were located on the first floor of the 25 building. Our suite felt just like home with granite countertops, tiled bathrooms, plasma tvs in the family room and both bedrooms and beautiful decor. My parents stayed in an efficiency which was perfect for them, however it was more standard than our accomodations. We were only asked once about taking the time share tour, which we declined. The staff was very friendly and professional, the grounds were well taken care of with flowers in bloom everywhere. My parents and daughter did eat in the restaurant for breakfast one morning which they said was great (the restaurant only serves breakfast from 8 - 10:30). We also mini golfed at the resort one afternoon, it was not in great shape but perfect for myself, mother and almost 4 year old daughter who gets tired of things quickly. They were replacing the pool heater while we were there so the pool was cold but we swam anyway. We had maintenance out with questions about the jacuzzi bath, they were prompt and very helpful. My husband and father fell in love with Pointe Royal Golf Course so ended up golfing it everday. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: comfortablynumb79
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and our 2 daughters spent a night at this resort on a cold night in late February and loved it. This resort is both a condominium community and a hotel. The buildings look more like upscale apartment buildings than hotel units. We booked it through Hotwire, paid $54, and were given a studio suite with a sleeper sofa, queen bed, and kitchenette. The room appeared to be brand new, or very lightly used. Furniture and decor were very warm and made us feel at home. There is a staffed activity counter with free internet workstations, free DVD rentals a pool. The L-shaped indoor pool was quite large, and was not crowded at all. The hot tub was quite a bit smaller by contrast. It would barely hold 4 people. For our stay here, which was brief, the hotel was more than sufficient. We hope to come again and stay longer when we visit Branson again.

Reviews.Title: “VALUE!”
Reviews.Author: myliltxtornado
Reviews.Content: Affordable and good value. Came to see the autumn colors and spend a nice weekend. Were not disappointed. Activities Department very accommodating. Restaurant had daily breakfast service plus a $9 Sunday Brunch with real, hand made country style food that was delicious. Would go again.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo00
Reviews.Content: Fist thing when we walked in there was a "musty" smell. I went to walk out to the balcony and the screen door fell off. Tried to fix it, but had to remove it . Then my girlfriend noticed some old cirgarette butts on the patio floor. She started "freaking" out not wanting to stay there. I tried to turn the ceiling fan on ,on the balcony and it didn't work. It was about 7pm and still daylight, so I wanted to take a drive around the place and especially see the marina and boat dock . Couldn't find it. Then in the morning, she went to make some coffee, and the coffee pot had old grinds in it and was all moldy.found out the next day the fishing dock and marina washed away in early spring. To top it off we came back Saturday night from Branson to see they moved in a family off about 10 right next us. Loud and Obnoxious. .Went to dry our beach towels and the did not want to put our clothes in it. A DUMP

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Mimi&papa
Reviews.Content: Got this resort for such a great price. And our studio was nice updated and clean. One thing I did'nt like was thin walls you could hear your neighbors talking and smell what they were cooking. The resort is so big we had a very hard time finding our unit. Never did find the pools or the marina they said they had.We drove around looking for them? And watch out for the timeshare pitch at checkin when you get your parking pass. Overall the place was nice and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay Overall”
Reviews.Author: christnme
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival for 4pm ck in was told room not ready come back in 30 min. Once in the 1 bedroom condo, noticed cleaning was not up to my standards. Room had quit a bit of dust all over everything, especially in corners of rooms, bottoms of funiture & fake plants. Other than built up dust room was pretty clean. Housekeeping came quickly upon request and removed dusty plants onto screened porch and did some quick lite dusting. The outside of the buildings are very nice. I loved the look of it. We were in the older buildings by the clubhouse, but not in bad shape. The grounds were kept up nicely, and given attention during our stay. The indoor pool is a great size, but small hot tub, both clean. There was an outdoor pool, kiddi pool & hot tub that stayed busy, did not use ourselves. Having a pull out sofa for kiddo's in a seperate room with a full kitchen, stackable washer/dryer,whirlpool tub with double sinks was really nice. The king size pillowtop bed was very comfortable with very nice bedding. Best of all was the wonderful screened in porch with ceiling fan to sit and relax in. Overall our stay was wonderful, just wish housekeeping would give a more attention to the detail cleaning of the overall room.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok....not 5 star OR Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: pledges
Reviews.Content: We own a timeshare on Maui through Consolidated resorts. We belong to Interval International and traded our week in Hawaii for a week in Branson. Branson was not our 1st choice but we needed to use our week or lose it and Branson was the only place we could get a room that was not too far from home and our time off would allow us to go there. This resort is ok. We had a studio which was comfortable enough, but definitely not spectacular. We could see others next door that looked much nicer. We were led to believe that they were all booked and the studio room we had was all that was left. Untrue, as we were there a week and could definitely see units that were empty. Much larger and nicer units. The marina was closed due to earlier flooding. The pool is small and 2 outdoor hot tubs are also very small. Only open until 10pm which we think is ridiculous...even the indoor pool which would not bother anyone to be open longer and neither would the hot tubs. We listened to the over long presentation and Diamond does have a better deal to purchase timeshares than what ours is, but I would not purchase one in Branson. It was a place to stay for the week. The whole timeshare thing is a scam from top to bottom. I have not stayed at a "5 star" timeshare yet and doubt they exist. Because our unit on Maui is a studio we are not going to be allowed to trade up (even though we were assured we could since we own in Hawaii) If we could find a way to sell ours without taking a loss we certainly would, just to be free of the headaches of trying to book when and where you want to go. Suites at Fall Creek is about a 2 or 3 star hotel TOPS and certainly not worth it. We received a 75.00 gift card for listening to the presentation and had I stayed for the whole thing maybe we would have gotten more. I left after 2 hours (we were told 90 minutes) Branson was ok, but not a place I would return to. NO big name shows there and nothing you can't do in most resort towns.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: SmirnoffGurl8
Reviews.Content: We are ready to go back and stay again! We were pretty impressed with our two bedroom suite. The only complaints we had are minimal. The lighting isn't very good in the bedrooms and the living and dining rooms could use a decor update. Neither of those made our stay any less enjoyable though. We especially enjoyed sitting on the screened in porch and taking a bath in the jacuzzi although they do take awhile to fill up and are rather loud so be prepared in case you plan to indulge.

Reviews.Title: “What a dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: missdjv
Reviews.Content: Last September, I recieved a call from Diamond Resorts, stating my family was "chosen" for a wonderful vacation at a 5 star resort. The representative told me that for a mere 279.00, I could stay at a deluxe 2BR resort for 4 days and 3 nights with wonderful amenities and close to 2 amusement parks. As i have 4 children who range from 7-15, it sounded like a great opportunity. I was told i needed to attend a short 90 minute no obligation timeshare but would recieve gifts at the end. So I paid and made reservations at that time for a Memorial weekend family getaway. When we arrived at the 4pm checkin time, we were given room 4 building 4. The place had a mildewed smell, and the tubs were dirty. There was a small lake less than 300 feet from the building, but when the kids went to investigate, 2 of them stepped in dog feces; It was all around the backyard patio. After an 8 hour drive, my oldest went to take a shower but the water turned ice cold after less than 10 minutes, and this was a normal occurrance for the duration of the stay. There were two children that looked less than 10 who were next to our room that ran around all night , screaming and cursing. We took the children to both the indoor and outdoor pools, which were nice but a bit crowded with unsupervised children. the next day, before the time share presentation, we met with other people who stated they were in these wonderful deluxe rooms with plasma tvs and for less than 200 for a week stay, they had been offered plus 100.00 and free show tickets to attend the presentaion. I started to become angry. We told the rep in the beginning of our presentation about the problems and he stated we were in a building that was not a time share building or a deluxe 2br, but one that is rented out by someone. He said the resort was double-booked and we must have been put there because of that. I explained Id made this reservation over 8 months earlier, but he just went into his speech. I was just getting more and more angry. I then asked him to show me what a "deluxe" 2BR was. He showed us this amazing model, with a FP and eurpoean shower; all that id been promised initially. He then started to badger me about this 25+ thousand timeshare package and Id had it. I walked out, collected my children and went back to the room. My husband filed a complaint about our room and when he went to collect the "gifts" it was basically a worthless coupon book. I do not advise going to this resort unless you are sure you will be in a deluxe and insist immediately to be moved if you get stuck like we did. We did not know what the options were out there, and when we did request to be moved, we were told basically since we were not purchasing the timeshare, the owners of the timeshares needed those rooms. I will never go back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Larsrob
Reviews.Content: My inlaws asked that we take them to Branson for their ninth visit to Branson to celebrate their 50th anniversary and we all totally enjoyed our stay in OUR specific unit. The two bedrooms had full spa baths and the place was huge. The furniture in our unit was very nice and we all felt right at home. We have stayed here (in another section) before and this was my inlaw's third stay at this property and each time the stay and service was satisfactory. Of course we did not use any of the property's quirks (pool, etc.) b/c we came to see Branson - and we were not disappointed. The only possible thing I might ask is for the property to add free wifi. Heck even the Motel 6 (and other lesser priced inn's) in Branson offers free wi fi and although we were told we could use the wifi at the office, this was not convenient. Otherwise, we are coming back without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied w/Fall Creek Plantation”
Reviews.Author: mimamama
Reviews.Content: Due to negative reviews, I worried for weeks about the condition of the property - we were bringing dear friends with us and would have been so embarrassed if the place was intolerable as had been stated. I took one reviewer's advice and called the reservation department sharing my concerns and requesting a quiet 4th floor unit far away from daily activities/programs - they were wonderful about giving us a unit way down by the water - very private. I was so nervous opening the unit door for our first glimpse of reality. I can't tell you how relieved I was!!! We were very, very pleased with our accommodations - fresh, crisp linens clean bathroom facilities-- kitchen appliances (look for extra clean towels under bathroom vanity), and carpeting & furniture was just fine. The only negative things I found were a couple broken floor tiles - nothing even worth mentioning to management... most of us have a couple broken somethings around home, don't we? (FYI - An $8,000,000 renovation is planned within the next year, so that will certainly take care of not-so-new furniture/carpeting complaints from previous vacationers.) Our reception by Fall Creek Plantation employees was just fine - excellent compared to the statements left by previous vacationers. Did they try to make a little $$$ on us by "updating" our Sunterra/Diamond membership? Yes. But we could have said "no." Besides, the 90 minute review/update benefitted us by $100. :) Would we agree to the "update" again? No. Don't be afraid to exchange to Fall Creek Plantation. By next year at this time, after the scheduled renovations are finished, it should be absolutely perfect. We always enjoy Branson and would not hesitate at all to return to FCP.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed!”
Reviews.Author: DisplacedYankee
Reviews.Content: We had seen the poor reviews and were initially concerned about what we would find. Yet our concerns dissolved when we saw the condo. We had a ground-level, wheelchair-accessible A/B unit near one of the outdoor pools and within a quick walk to the activities center. The rooms were spacious and generally clean and, although outdated, the furniture was still in good repair. Except for the intermittent sound of running water or movement upstairs, the unit was very quiet. The staff were polite and responsive to queries. The location provided easy access to Branson/family activities, but was not in the middle of town. Parking may be an issue during peak season for those needing a parking space with wheelchair access. Those with units on upper floors may not appreciate needing to climb stairs. We definitely are considering going back next year!

Reviews.Title: “We don't care if you stay here or not!”
Reviews.Author: ladybug0603
Reviews.Content: We (my husband, daughter-8, son-4, mom-64, dad-66 and myself) arrived to check into our condo at 3:30 pm. We were told to come back in 30 minutes and our room would be ready. We arrived back at 4:00 PM, which was the scheduled check in time, we were told it would be another 30 minutes. Once we were able to check in, no one apologized for the wait. The clerk at the desk kept mumbling like Charlie Brown's teacher. We finally had to tell him to speak up. We could not understand him. Once we arrived to our room which was not "walking distance to the pool" the door to the condo was wide open. It was 100 degrees out side. We went inside and things seemed to be in place, but they had not dusted in over 4 weeks. We could sign our names in the dust. We went to turn on the air conditioner. It was broke. It never got below 87 degrees in the condo. We called the front desk and told them our problem. They said they would send a maintainence person some time tonight. We told them we wanted a person now! They said they would work on it. An hour later, he finally arrived and said yes the air was not working. Well DUH!!!!!!! He told us to contact Sherri, the manager. She said nothing about being sorry for inconvenience. She said she would check to see if she had anything else for us and call us back. In the mean time, we were in limbo waiting for her to call back, in a room that was 87+ degrees and it was over 100 degrees outside. We finally had to call her back becasue she did not call us (30 minutes later). She said she had something and to come to the front desk in 15 minutes! We loaded everything back up and hauled it back down 2 flights of stairs with no help from the staff. Once we arrived at the front desk, the clerk asked us what we needed. Sherri motioned to the clerk with out stepping out from her office, and gave him the new room keys for us. Once again, NO APOLOGIES! We drove back to our new condo, which they said was by the pool too. They failed to let us know that pool was closed. It was closed becuase it was still under construction! Our room was now on the 3rd floor, once again, no one to help us haul all of our things up stairs in 100+ degree weather! Once inside, the air worked, FINALLY! The furniture had some holes, the pillows were as thin as sheets of paper, and the dishwaher knob was stuck. They tell you to leave the dishwasher running to wash the dishes you used, upon check out. We almost broke out wrist trying to turn the dishwasher knob in order to comply with their cleaning requests. They do not have daily maid service for your towels. You have to bring them to the front desk to change them out or you wash them your self! I did not realize I became a member of their cleaning staff and paid them too. The deck was very greasy from the barbecue pit which is easily tracked everywhere! If you just need a place to stay and don't care about courtesy or accomodations then this is the place for you. Otherwise, I would definitely think twice about staying here. When we checked out we even brought all of these things to their attention, and once again....no one ever apologized! They just do not care. They just want your money.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it's cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: annieLincoln_NE
Reviews.Content: it's very dissapointing to see impressive pictures of a resort only to be let down. The Plantation at Fall Creek was no where near what it is portrayed to be. The overall aura of this place was cheap, plasticky and substandard. TO NAME JUST A FEW OF THE ISSUES... The decor and furniture were outdated, the veneer was pealing off of the bathroom cabinets, there were plaint splatters on the tile floor in the bathroom, there were no kleenexes, no extra toilet paper, two towels (total), there was no mattress cover on the bed (and let's just say the mattress was less than desirable), the blinds were cheap metal blinds that were rusting in the corners (and provided no block to the sun at 6 in the morning) I could go on, but I digress. That said, don't stay here. There are hundreds (literally) of other affordable places to stay in Branson that are far better.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Love5th
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we were very excited as the "resort" looked very nice. I am an owner through RCI, and the depiction of Sunterra through RCI is very very deceving. It boasts or 5 large outdoor pools, a restaurant, lake, etc. We really found out that the pools are very small for repsrt standards, the restaurant is actually a "buffet" that serves 2-3 items at breakfast and lunch only. Since we are owners, we thought the studio we booked would have been pretty nice. However, the mini-college-sized fridge did not work, and we had to throw all of our cold food away. After making three phone within 4 hours, someone finally came to look at the fridge. He stated that it is only a cooler and not a fridge. Oddly enough, there was a huge chunk of ice in the freezer area that was so large it could no be taken out. Wow. That is pretty nuts for a cooler. After that, we were switched to a newer studio, which was more roomy with a pull out couch and updated furniture, etc. The staff was extremely friendly. Overall, we were very disappointed since this place was built up to be something that it wasn't. At most, I would call this a cheesy resort- maybe!!!

Reviews.Title: “Probably Better Choices in Branson”
Reviews.Author: SirPher
Reviews.Content: If you read other review, you do get the general idea that there are probably better places to stay in Branson. Good points - very big 2 bedroom condo, good location, good pool and clubhouse with plenty of things to do. Bad points - 'paper-thin walls', to the point where not only can you hear the neighbors upstairs, but you can hear neighbors talking from the next building over. Problems with insects and spiders and management indifference to correcting those issues. Stairs for the building we were in were in bad shape to the point of being dangerous (we did see where a couple of buildings where the stairs were being demolished and reconstructed.)

Reviews.Title: “Accomodations wonderful/selling not so good”
Reviews.Author: Gindo
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the resort. We booked our trip on Orbitz. We utilized the concierge to purchase tickets for Dixie Stampede. (I would highly recommend this show!) We were a little thrown off by the 90 minute presentation to buy a timeshare. I did not realize it would take over two hours. And it became a tad pushy once we said no. We would definately not have said yes to the presentation if we had known it would be so time consuming and aggressive. Our children were very bored while we were in the meeting. We were upset that we took that time away from their vacation But we really liked our one bedroom condo. It provided us with a place to kick back and eat breakfast and lunch instead of hitting a restaurant for every meal. We would definately recommend this resort for family's!! The kids loved the pool and miniature golf. We had to drive to the pool, but that was soooo not a big deal at all!!! And it really was only minutes to the strip. We didn't have any of the bad experiences that the other people talked about. Our condo was clean and very nice. And well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Marginal”
Reviews.Author: pblancha
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here in a one bedroom studio. We are Sunterra owners in Hawaii, and thought we would see what they had locally, since it is under two hours away, we thought what the heck. The front desk staff is extremely courteous and professional. We went to the room and thought, OK, its small, but we expected better, not only because we were Sunterra owners, had to take the tour etc., but we thought if they wanted us to buy something, wouldn't they put us in the best accomodations? Minor things, hair dryer didn't work, not that I need to worry about that, but my wife does - maintenance staff extremely prompt courteous and efficient. Cabinets all showed signs of delamination. Also you needed a PhD to figure out how to use the HVAC. Major things. Every light in the entire complex was on 24x7. It was like sleeping under klieg lights in Manhattan. Buildings showed significant hail damage - as a resident of Missouri, the last major hailstorm we had was in May. Most major thing. Walls are PAPER THIN. If the family next door with the unsupervised at risk kids were whispering, you could hear them. Unfortunately they weren't. It was so bad we packed up and went home. We were on the top floor. I suppose if you had a top floor two bedroom unit it would be OK, but I don't think that I would chance it again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort.”
Reviews.Author: smrcjsc
Reviews.Content: We've traded to many Sunterra Resorts, including Fall Creek, and all of our experiences have been excellent. After we check in and see the accommodations, we look at each other and say, "I'm so glad we did this!". We've always had great experiences at Sunterra Resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: homestyles
Reviews.Content: After I had booked this resort through RCI, I started reading the negative online reviews and was feeling very leery about staying here, especially since we had invited a couple to vacation with us. I called the resort directly several different times expressing my concerns about the negative reviews I had been reading. I made several requests regarding my choice of accomodations several months before our stay. I'm very happy to report that these requests were honored completely. We had a beautiful, clean, spacious 2 bedroom unit. Everything on site appeared to be in excellent condition, and the staff was very courteous and helpful. We stayed in a timeshare unit on the top floor and had a gorgeous view of the fall foliage.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but will do...”
Reviews.Author: laughingdogs
Reviews.Content: We traded for this condo through RCI, our timeshare bank. We booked a studio which is just a hotel-type room. We have a toddler and there just was not enough room for all the baby stuff we brought and the bar sink could not accomodate any real washing of anything. Our biggest complaint at first were the paper thin walls. We could hear EVERYTHING being said and done in the unit next door. They were night owls so they made plenty of noise every night around 3 a.m. Then our hot water ran out right in the middle of giving our baby a bath. That was it. We went to the front desk, yes you have to drive there since it's a huge property. The manager was not in until the afternoon so we lodged our complaint and request to move to a bigger unit away from the noisy people. I think we had some other issues about the unit but I must have a memory block. The manager did offer us a larger unit, for an additional fee, in a building that was being renovated. I have to say that she was very snotty with us during the whole process. We inspected the unit first. It was very nice except for some very shoddy workmanship. The bathroom tile floor actually cracked as we walked on it. But, the unit was a 1 bedroom and it was HUGE. We didn't have any neighbors for a night or two, but when they arrived we definitely heard them. The problem seems to lie with the connecting doors. But, seriously, you can hear everything. It's pretty bad. They are situated on Lake Tanycomo and my husband was able to drive down to the dock and fish to his heart's content. The restaurant was terrible. We did use the indoor pool and it was fine and seemed clean. Overall, it was OK after we were moved to the larger and nicer unit. We decided we would stay there again if we could inspect our unit first and got an updated unit. Since we know about the noise problem it won't come as a surprise. The draw for us is the amenity of the on-site fishing dock and indoor pool for our child.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: officegal67
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay, especially if you have children and need more room than a hotel room. The condo was very nice and clean. The beds where comfortable as well. The staff was very friendly and helpful as well. I timed the drive to the downtown strip and it was 4 minutes (in light traffic). I highly recommend this to anyone. A++++++++++

Reviews.Title: “Fall Creek Disappoints”
Reviews.Author: ethelred
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after enjoying a week at the nearby Palace View By Spinnaker and after that perhaps we were expecting too much. The units themselves are well furnished with everyting one could need with nice little touches like decent free toiletries. However what lets the resort down is that it is far too big and spread out. Admiitedly we were within walking distance of a good fishing spot but to take advantageof the resort's pools.table tennis,crazy golf etc a car journey was necessary. Our stay was ruined also by the fact that we had a ground floor apartment with what could only be termed an extended family of noisy rednecks above who had liitle regard for thye usual accepted standards of behaviour. Our attempts to be moved to another apartment also fell on deaf ears. On a more positive note the resort has use of a small marina from which fishing boats,bait and equipment can be hired or bought. The marina also serves as a good place to fish from .Although neither my son or I caught any of the fabled monster trout we did catch some fish and enjoyed seeing wildlife such as a beaver and three playful racoons who would come out every night to scavenge in the trash cans.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: baldknobbers
Reviews.Content: This is primarily a timeshare property, however we did find our room on Expedia--and for a very excellent price. Overall, the place is nice, with lots of activities. We stayed in a "studio": a.k.a. one bedroom with mini-kitchen. The room itself was very clean, well designed and very comfortable. Honestly, we got more than we expected for the price. Things to look out for: The walls are very thin. So thin, we could hear our neighbors watching TV and discussing news of the day. I'm sure they could hear us as well. We stayed in one of the "Villas" typically used by timeshare owners. The layout of the property includes an RV park and a place for doublewides. These areas are not very separate from the "luxury resort" vibe Sunterra tries to project to prospective clients. If we weren't staying on the fourth floor I could understand why guests aren't happy about staying in a nice resort with a view of a trailer park. Buildings are too far apart...especially from pools/activities etc. Perhaps they are going to build more recreation areas to match new construction? When we arrived to check in, security guards were scrambling to deal with three separate reports of theft. (Two purses and a pair of gold earings). The on-site restaurant offers a very affordable breakfast buffet. $3.99--ya get what ya pay for and if you don't expect a huge smorgasboard you won't be disappointed. -If you are going to check out shows in Branson...the concierge desk offers some very nice discounts. When we arrived, a woman at the concierge desk asked if we would be interested in attending a timeshare presentation. While it wasn't the purpose of our trip, the incentives were well worth 90mins of our time.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting stay at Sunterra”
Reviews.Author: dancemommy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in building 12 and our bathtub was so dirty that we had to get some bleach to clean it. I don't understand how they could have put the towels in there without cleaning it. We have a video. Called the place and they said the maid service was gone. A salesman called the next morning and only tried to get us to go to the "open house". He was not concerned at all about the bathtub. The pools were very cloudy. I would not recommend this place at all to anyone. You have to drive to most places to swim.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT at Sunterra Plantation!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked on-line and really had no idea what to expect. We were very thrilled upon arrival. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and we had everything we needed upon arrival. We stayed in a 2BR condo. It was beautiful and very comfortable for all 6 of us who stayed there. There is plenty to do in and around Branson but it was nice to have a resort to come back to so if we wanted a relaxing day we could hang out at the pool, golf, take a boat out etc.. all right there at the resort. We will absolutely be back and I've recommended this resort to numerous friends since being home. Also, very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “It was very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Plantation has a lot to offer - swimming, tennis, ping pong, volleyball, putt-putt golf and basketball. We stayed with a group of people takilng up 7 rooms. All of the rooms were very nice except ours. The main problem in my unit was that the carpet was badly stained and the flooring in the kitchen and bathrooms needed to be replaced/upadated. These things made the room look shabby compared to the others in our group. Their rooms were decorated nicely and had tile flooring and clean carpeting. Our room also smelled heavily of smoke even though there was a no smoking sign posted in the unit. We did have a beautiful view of the golf course. There were no bugs inside the units and just your normal everyday bugs outside. If I had had a room like the rest of my group, I would have said my stay was great!! Just to let you know - my room was 1507, and I did let the front desk know that the flooring needed to be updated.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Anywhere, but here!”
Reviews.Author: SNAFU23
Reviews.Content: In June 2006, we spent two evenings at the Sunterra at Falls Creek, and felt this was one of the worst lodging experiences we've ever had. The condo unit we got was very small, old, and poorly maintained. There was no daily maid service. Each night we had to clear the spider webs from outside the front door. There is no evening restaurant on the very large property. This is the best part, the only ice machine was about 1 mile from our room, in a poorly lit, isolated outside area. No joking. When I asked the front desk receptionist in disbelief if she was kidding, she said "no, and I wish they would get more ice machines, because I'm tired of the guest getting upset." There were several nice amenities and activities on the property, but in reality the main goal of the lodging is to get you to buy a timeshare. Which is really what they are geared toward. This location is at least a 3 mile drive to the main Branson strip, and there is only a couple of restaurants nearby, none within walking distance. I would never stay at this property again, and would advise the same to anyone else thinking of staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a great place for me, my husband, and four kids to stay. we had a great time. we went swimming, played mini golf, and slept in a nice 2 bedroom condo with all the extras. I loved having the choice of cooking which saved us money to enjoy other activities. I also liked the tvs in each room to help unwind after a long day. The screened in balocony was great to have breakfast on. I did not like cleaning up my room, because we weresceduled for the sales pitch and and the let us go AFTER out checkout time and we told the front desk they only gave us about30 extra minutes to check out. Well that woukd be okay but we had to clean the unit before checkout and as you can imagine with 4 kids that can be a chore. So I believe if they want to give you the long sell they should give you a lot of slack in the cleanup or the checkout time. Overall great stay and good time filler for kids.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place!”
Reviews.Author: travelwhere
Reviews.Content: Our 2 bedroom unit was beautifully decorated. The screened in patio was a delight. The grounds were nice but the best part was the free activity check out. You can get free dvds, pingpong balls, horseshoes, basket balls, volley balls, play free miniture golf, get games, etc. There is plenty to do. The location on hwy 165 is near the attractions. They serve a nice breakfast buffet for $3.99 plus drinks. There is a lunch buffet but I did not have it. No regular dinners onsite. I got lost using mapquest, but just remember that it is right on hwy 165. I will definately plan to return. The Titanic Museum was very nicely done and is highly recommended. Ripley's Believe it or Not was just OK. Not sure what we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience with Sunterra”
Reviews.Author: American_Bureaucrat
Reviews.Content: I am a Sunterra timeshare owner who has stayed at a half dozen Sunterra properties across the U.S. and UK and would say my April 2006 3-day stay at Plantation at Fall Creek compared favorably to other Sunterra properties, all of which I've been generally pleased with. My family had a 2-bedroom, 2-bath suite in Building 23 (about 100 yds behind the activities center), which was was very large and well appointed. My kids (10 and 7) and I were very pleased with Activities Center's policy of loaning out free everything needed to play the 18-hole mini-golf course, shuffleboard, basketball, and pool towels. They even provided us a selection of hundreds of movies (for the dual DVD/VHS player in the living room) free of charge. All in all, a very pleasant stay. I found intriguing that the resort contains a marina with bass boat and platform boat rentals by the hour or day but didn't actually rent. All in all, found it to be a nice property.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: CVan
Reviews.Content: From some of the reviews I had read on this site, we were expecting the worst from Plantation at Fall Creek. We were pleasantly surprised though by the spaciousness of our 1 bedroom and the helpfulness of the staff. Our view of the trailer park on the north side of the resort was the only real disappointment we had. The signage at the entrance was old-looking and in need of an update. However, the place was very clean and everything in the unit worked well. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort March 10-16,2006. The rooms were nice and clean. They have a large jacuzzi tub, kitchen, washer/dryer and screened porch. The indoor pool is large and clean. There are plenty of scheduled activities for all. They have fitness center,18 hole putt putt, ping pong, darts, shuffleboard, horseshoes, playground, games and movies to check out. Also pool equipment.All for free. Overall it is a great place for families. I didn't find any of the problems others had mentioned. No spiders or bugs. It was clean and well lit. We loved it and would go back.

HotelInfo.Name: Suites at Fall Creek
HotelInfo.Address: 1 Fall Creek Drive, Branson, MO 65616 (Formerly Sunterra Plantation At Fall Creek)
